texts.es: Doña Mirta es una clienta que ha trabajado desde hace muchos años para mantener a sus hijos quienes hoy en día ya son mayores de edad e independientes y ahora le ayudan, siempre sigue luchando con la pulpería desde hace muchos años  negocio que le es muy rentable por lo que está muy contenta  el cual lo administra con su esposo, este tercer crédito lo solicita para invertir en su negocio comprando granos básicos, lácteos, embutidos, gaseosas, carnes, golosinas, productos de limpieza para el hogar y el asea personal entre otros, todos estos productos de la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Doña Mirta is a client who has worked many years in order to support her children.  Today her children are already grown and independent.  They are now helping her.  Mirta always continued to work hard at her grocery store and it has been very profitable for many years.  For this reason, she is pleased to be managing this business with her husband.  

This is the third loan she has requested.  Mirta will invest in her business by purchasing basic grains, dairy products, sausages, sodas, meats, snack foods, household cleaning products, toiletries, and other items.  All of these products are demanded by her customers.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products, sausages, sodas, meats, snack foods, household cleaning products, toiletries, and other items.

loans.name: Leonela Jajaira

texts.es:
La Señora. Leonela se encuentra realizando su primer crédito en el banco comunal El Arenal, fue invitada a formar parte de este grupo por una amiga. Vive por la comunidad de Misicata que pertenece a la parroquia de Baños que se encuentra a ocho kilómetros al oeste de Cuenca, a 15 minutos del centro histórico de la ciudad. Las propiedades curativas de las vertientes de aguas termales que salen desde las montañas adyacentes hicieron de Baños un próspero centro turístico, además de su gastronomía y sus varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente es amable, de un corazón cálido y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

La Señora Leonela tiene 28 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 5 hijos, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y sus tres hijos siguientes estudian en una escuela de la localidad, su último hijo pasa en casa. Su esposo se dedica al comercio, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Leonela al igual que su esposo se dedican a la de ropa desde hace 12 años, trabajan de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, esta actividad le permite estar al cuidado de sus hijos. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para tener una mayor variedad y estilos para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Leonela is receiving her first loan as a member of the El Arenal communal bank. She was invited by a friend to become a member of this group. She lives in the community of Misicata, which belongs to Baños parish and is located eight kilometers west of Cuenca, 15 minutes from that city's historic center. Baños is a thriving tourist center, thanks to the healing properties of thermal springs fed by the adjacent mountains, its cuisine, and the variety of places to enjoy nature. The people are friendly, warm-hearted, and still maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

Leonela is 28 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has five children. Her oldest daughter is in high school and her next three children study at a local school. Her youngest son is at home. Her husband is a merchant. They do not have their own house, so they rent.

Leonela, along with her husband, has been selling clothing for 12 years. They work from Sunday to Sunday, without a fixed schedule. This work allows Leonela to be at home with her children.

She is going to invest this loan in the purchase of clothing, so that she can have better variety and styles for her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
La Señora María forma parte del banco comunal El Arenal hace algún tiempo, tiempo en el que ha formado parte de un hermoso grupo, donde todas las socias son unidas, amables y siempre se ayudan en algún problema. Vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que goza de una geografía accidentad con paisajes hermosos, cuenta con muchos lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su arquitectura colonial le dio el título de Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad en Diciembre de 1999.

La Señora María es una mujer muy joven tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 niños de 11, 9, 7 y 2 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doñas María se dedica a la confccion de ropa deportiva en su taller y a la venta de todo tipo ropa desde hace algunos años, le gusta este trabajo porque le da la oportunidad de ser independiente económicamente y al mismo tiempo pasa en su casa al cuidado de sus hijos.

El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en materiales para su taller y  las ganancia que obtuvo fueron de mucha ayuda para solventar muchos gastos de su hogar, en los pagos de dicho crédito no tuvo ningún problema ya que cancelo en las fechas indicadas. Su nuevo crédito también lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para tener una mayor variedad de prendas de vestir para su exigente clientela.
texts.en:
Señora María has been part of the El Arenal communal bank for some time now. This is a lovely group. All the members are united, kind, and always help with any problems. María lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca, a city surrounded by beautiful countryside and with many places to enjoy nature. Cuenca's colonial architecture won it the designation of World Heritage Site in December 1999.
María is a very young woman; she is 26 and is the single mother of four children ages 11, 9, 7, and 2. Her three eldest children go to a small school in the city. They do not have their own home; they rent.
María makes sports clothing in her workshop and has sold all kinds of clothing for several years. She likes this work because it allows her to be independent economically and to spend time at home taking care of her children.
She invested her previous loan in materials for her workshop. Her income from this loan was very useful and covered many of her household costs. She did not have any trouble repaying the previous loan, and she repaid the installments on the payment dates as planned. She will also invest this new loan in the purchase of clothing in order to have a greater variety for her demanding clientele.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal El Arenal hace 3 años, tiempo en el cual ha llegada a tener muy buenas amistades y se han consolidado como una familia, vive por el sector del Vecino en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que goza de una geografía accidentada con paisajes hermosos,  cuenta con muchos lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su arquitectura colonial le dio el título de Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad en Diciembre de 1999.

Doña María tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos todos son mayores de edad, dos de ellos son casados y vive  independientes, su hijo soltero estudia en la universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la docencia ya que es profesor,  no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 

A la Señora. María le gusta el arte culinario, por lo que tiene un restaurante desde hace 15 años, trabaja en su negocio de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo, este trabajo le ha permitido aportar a la economía de su hogar. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la remodelación de su local y en la compra de vajilla. 

Su meta es terminar su casa para ya no vivir arrendando.
texts.en:
Señora María is has been a member of the El Arenal communal bank for 3 years, over which time she has come to have very good friendships and they have become like a family. She lives in the Vecino neighbourhood in the city of Cuenca, which enjoys a rolling geography and beautiful landscapes. There are many places to enjoy nature and its colonial architecture gave it the title of World Heritage Site in December 1999.

Doña María is 50 years old and is married with 3 adult children. Two are married and live independently. Her unmarried son studies at university. Her husband works as a teacher. They do not have their own home and so they rent.

Señora María enjoys cooking, which is why she has had a restaurant for 15 years. She works there Monday - Saturday with no fixed hours. This work has allowed her to contribute to the household income.

Her new loan will be invested in remodelling the premises and to buy crockery.

Her dream is to finish building a house so that they don't have to rent.

loans.use: to buy crockery and remodel the premises.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia de 52 años de edad habita junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy honesta y responsable.  Posee un pequeño negocio donde vende chocobananos, bolis,  paletas y demás alimentos de refrigeración aparte vede ropa de manera ambulante siempre le ha gustado dar lo mejor de si y entregarse de lleno en el trabajo siendo una gran ejemplo para sus hijos y demás familia. Lidia desea incrementar más su venta y para esto se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y comprar leña, cacao, palitos de pincho, fruta, banano, azúcar entre otros espera contar con al ayuda y espero en Dios que no la abandonara y le permitirá dando la bendición de llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en:
Fifty-two year old Lidia lives with her life partner and their children.  She is a very hard-working woman who has always been portrayed as very honest and responsible.

She has a small business where she sells choco-bananas, freezer pops, popsicles and other refrigerated foods.  She also sells clothing on the street.  She has always liked giving the best of herself and giving of herself fully to her work, serving as a good example to her children and the rest of her family.

Lidia wishes to increase her sales and for this reason approached INTEGRAL to apply for a loan to buy firewood, cocoa, skewers, fruit, bananas and sugar, among other things.  She hopes to be able to count on the assistance, and hopes that God will not abandon her and will give her the blessing to take home the daily bread.

loans.use: to buy firewood, cocoa, skewers, fruit, bananas and sugar, among other things.

loans.name: Ninehele

texts.en:
Ninehele was born in 1962; she is married and a mother of four children. She lives in Bamenda Northwest region of Cameroon.

Due to so many family problems beyond her control, she got married to a polygamist with many children and single handedly took care of her own children, this includes buying and providing for her children's needs both in school and at home. She is also responsible for paying for hospital bills and other bills of the house. Motivated by all these circumstances, she became a member of GHAPE in 1998 and has successfully managed and repaid loans nine times. The profit from these loans has helped her enormously in taking care of the above-mentioned responsibilities.

If given a loan she intends to buy Irish potato, yam, and corn seeds. She also intends to continue with her cultivation of cassava. Her business is going to succeed because she has been doing it for close to 20 years.

She owns a vast piece of farmland and has prior experience in farming of the above-mentioned crops. She intends to use the profit from this loan to educate her children, pay for hospital bills, and for the basic needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy Irish potato and corn seeds, and fertilizer

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village in Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Chanthy is 31 years old and married. She has two children to take care of, one of whom is still in school and one is too young for school. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer for two years and supplements the income by planting beans and raising ducks. The current business earns her about 57,000 KHR per day and she manages her to save about 20,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.
 
Chanthy has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her to better support her family with enough food. Now she is seeking another loan of 3,000,000 KHR to buy more ducks to raise. She hopes to fatten her ducks and sell them for a good price to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to raise

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Vin's Group

texts.en:
44-year-old Vin is a married mother of four children living in the Prey Chor district of Kampong Cham province. Two of her children are dependent on her and still in school. She is a rice farmer and sometimes works for others for a fee to gain extra income. She has been in the business for 20 years. She can earn about 27,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day.
 
Vin’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back their past loans. The previous loan has helped Vin to better support her family with enough foods as well as household supplies. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Vin is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland and pay for water pumping. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Living in a rural village located in the Pursat province’s Kro Kor district, Yen is 45 and married with seven children, two of whom are still in dependent on her and still in school. For the last 20 years, she has been farming rice as a primary business for her family while her husband catches fish to better support her family. The current business earns her about 18,000 KHR per day to make a living and she can save about 8,000 KHR each day for their future needs.
. 
Yen is taking her fifth microloan with VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her to better support her family’s business. Now she is seeking another loan of 2,500,000 KHR to build a decent house for her family. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a proper house for her family to live in.

loans.use: To build a decent house for her family

loans.name: Sokhalay's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Sokhalay is a 29-year-old widowed mother of one daughter who is still in school. To support the family, she has been selling meatballs and sugarcane juice for five years. She is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family needs. 

Sokhalay has joined VisionFund this cycle, while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Sokhalay is now leading her group of two to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more meatballs for resale. She hopes earn more income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy more meatballs to resale

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in the Pursat province’s Kror Kor district, Yat is a 45-year-old mother of four dependent children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To support her children, Yat has been farming rice for several years and her husband has been working as a paid worker in the local area to earn additional income. Together, they can earn about 17,000 KHR per day and can save about 7,000 KHR each day for their future needs.

Yat has been with VisionFund for one cycle and successfully repaid her loan, which has helped to better her family with enough household supplies. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a cow to raise. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a cow to raise and help her in her paddy field business.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise

loans.name: Sdoeng's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Pursat province’s Kandieng district, Sdoeng is aged 29 years and married with one daughter who is still in school. She has been selling fish and vegetables to support her family while her husband supplements the income by farming rice and raising pigs. Together, they can earn about 70,000 KHR per day and can save about 20,000 KHR each day for the future needs.

Sdoeng’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pig feed for her pig business and to use a portion of it to spend on buying various kinds of vegetables for resale.  She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to better her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pig feed for her pig business.

loans.name: Yong's Group

texts.en:
A widow living in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Yong is 61 years and earns a living through farming rice, planting watermelons and beans, and sometimes supplementing her income by raising cows. She has 11 children, one of whom works as a paid construction worker to better support the family. Having been in this business for thirty-five years, she can earn about 54,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Yong has been with VisionFund for six cycles while the other members have been from four to seven cycles. She completely repaid back the past loans, which have helped her to better support her family. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully so as to make better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Rith's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Rith is aged 40 years and married with two dependent children who are still in school. He is a teacher and is sometimes involved in buying and selling rice in a local area. His wife also supplements the family income by selling snacks. Together, they have been engaging in this business for six years.

Rith has been with VisionFund for four cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. The previous loans have helped him to better support his family’s living conditions. Now he is leading his group of two to apply for a loan. Rith is going to use his portion to buy more rice to resell. He hopes to earn more from his current business so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more rice for resale.

loans.name: Saron's Group

texts.en:
Saron, 49, lives with her family members in a rural village in the Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Cambodia. She has six children, two of whom are still in school. For the last 20 years, she and her husband have been farming rice as the main source of her family’s income. The current business earns her about KHR 25,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Saron has been with VisionFund for five cycles and the other member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She completely repaid the past loans, which have helped her to relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to get a high yield from her paddy-rice  to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Campanayoq De Huaran Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CAMPANAYOQ DE HUARAN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Armandina ella es conviviente y tiene 55 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia vende telares y chompas hechas de alpaca, la socia vende en forma independiente llevando a diferentes lugares donde venden artesanía, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chompas y telares.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de discos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de crianza de animales y negocio de venta de ganados.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank called Campanayoq de Huaran.  This bank is located in the district of Calca, in the province of Calca, and the region of Cusco.                                                                                                                                         

Armandina is a member who is 55 years old and lives with her spouse.  She has four children.  She makes a living selling handcrafted items.  She sells looms and sweaters made of alpaca wool.  She is an independent vendor and takes her goods to various locations where crafts are sold.

She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  Her dream is to open a store where she can sell her crafts.  She has requested the loan in order to buy sweaters and looms.

The other members of the bank make a living selling records, selling groceries, raising animals, and selling cattle.  

Armandina is grateful to those who have helped her reach her dream via this method and she promises to complete the payment of her loan by the established deadline.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and looms.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; Este banco se ubicado en  la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Segundina ella es conviviente, tiene 34 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboración de desayunos, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que es quinua con leche,leche,pan,tortas entre otros, la socia trabaja todos los días desde las 06:00am hasta 10:00am aproximadamente, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como quinua, azucar, leche entre otros.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la crianza de animales, venta de comida, maestro constructor, brindando el servicio de taxi, locutorio.

La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Las Triunfadoras communal bank.  It is located in the Cusco province and Cusco department.

Segundia, age 34, is in a common-law marriage and has one child.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of making breakfasts, and she sells in an itinerant manner.  She has been in this business for years.  It is going well for her thanks to the determination that she puts into her business every day.

She sells quinoa with milk, milk, bread, and sandwiches, among others.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until approximately 10:00 a.m.  This is the way that she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies like quinoa, sugar, and milk, among others.

The other members devote themselves to raising animals, selling food, being a master builder, providing taxi service, and running a call center.

The member who appears in the added photo requested permission to arrive late to the meeting.

She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through the loan.  She pledges to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy supplies like quinoa, sugar, and milk, among others.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Marcelina, sigue dedicandose a la agricultura y ganaderia,la socia se siente feliz realizando estas actividades ya que le trae satisfaciones tanto economicas como personales,la socia cria vacas para luego venderlas en las ferias de los fines de semana,siendo de esta forma que la socia apoya economicamente a su familia.


La socia solicita el credito para la compra de un torete.

La socia agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada
texts.en:
This communal bank member belongs to the communal bank "San Martin de Zurite," which is located in the town of Zurite, in the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

Señora Marcellina continues working in agriculture and livestock-raising. She feels happy doing this work since it brings her economic as well as personal satisfaction. She raises cattle to later sell at the weekend fairs. This is how she supports her family economically.

She is applying for the loan to buy a young bull.

She is grateful for the loan offered and promises to complete the payment of her debts in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy a young bull

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicandose a la agricultura,la socia lleva años dedicandose a esta actividad la cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia siembra lo que son papa,maiz entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para su chacra.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to engage in agriculture. She has been in this line of work for years and has done well thanks to the effort she puts each day into her business. The borrower grows potatoes, corn, and other crops. She is a responsible person who works in this manner so that she can help her family move forward.

The borrower is requesting a loan so that she can buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicandose a la agricultura ,la socia lleva años dedicandose a esta actividad la cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia siembra lo que son papa,maiz entre otros, a la vez la socia continua dedicandose a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para su chacra.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to engage in agriculture. She has been in this line of work for years and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her business each day. The borrower grows potatoes, corn, and other crops. She also continues to raise small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens. Working in this manner, enables her to help her family move forward.

The borrower is requesting a loan so that she can buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.

El Sr. Anastacio, sigue dedicandose a la agricultura y ganaderia,el socio se siente bien dedicandose a estas actividades ya que mediante esto el socio apoya a su familia,el socio cria vacas para luego venderlas en las ferias de los fines de semana como tambien lo que cosecha en su chacra papa,maiz entre otros,el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para seguir apoyando a su familia.


El socio solicita el credito para comprar fertilizantes y abono para su chacra.
El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "San Martin de Zurite", which is located in the town of Zurite, Anta province, in the Cusco department.

Anastacio continues working in agriculture and raising livestock. He feels good working in these businesses considering that by doing it he supports his family. He raises cows to sell at the weekend markets along with what he harvests from his farm - potato and corn among other things. He wants to be able to carry on working so he can keep supporting his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and manure for his farm. He values and is thankful for the loan offered, and commits to paying back his debts in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for his farm.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Encarnacion;la socia sigue dedicandose al negocio de venta de verduras,la socia se siente bien con su negocio ya que mediante este la socia puede apoyar economicamente a su familia,la socia vende lo que son zanahorias,tomates,zapallo entre otros,la socia vende en uno de los mercados desde las 07;00am hasta 13:00pm ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia. 


La socia solicita el credito para la compra de tomates y cebolla para su negocio.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Encarnación belongs to the communal bank “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; which is located in the district of Zurite, Anta province, in the department of Cuzco.  She still has her business selling vegetables.  She is happy with her business because it allows her to support her family financially.  She sells carrots, tomatoes, and squash, among other vegetables.  She sells at one of the markets from 7am until 1pm.  She would like to continue working in this way to continue supporting her family.  She is requesting a loan to purchase tomatoes and onions for her business.  She is happy about the loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for her business.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
María es uno de los miembros del  grupo Corazón de Jesús

María tiene 49 años. Ella es casada con 02 hijos. María se dedica a la venta de frutas, fue su esposo quien la ánimo a empezar este negocio, él también se dedica a lo mismo pero vendiendo en diferentes mercados. María trabaja en su misma casa donde tiene su frutería, sus mayores compradores son sus vecinos y transeúntes de la zona donde vive, le va muy bien en su negocio y se siente muy feliz por apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos familiares. Con el dinero de su préstamo va a comprar fruta en grandes cantidades para aminorar el costo, de otro lado también se dedica al reciclaje de botellas y cartón que después vende generándole una ganancia adicional, en el futuro desea que sus hijos sean profesionales y en cuanto a su negocio que este siga creciendo para convertirse en uno de los mejores.
María quiere agradecer  a todos los Inversionistas de KIVA por su préstamo y el de su grupo comunal.
En la foto aparece con polo plomo y gorra.
texts.en:
María is one of the members of the group “Corazón de Jesús” (Heart of Jesus). She is 49 years old, married, and has two children. María sells fruit and it was her husband who encouraged her to start this business. He also sells fruit, but he works at different markets.

María works by selling fruit at her house. Her major customers are neighbors and pedestrians in the area where she lives. María’s business is doing very well and she is pleased that she can help her husband generate income for their family. With the money from her loan, María will buy fruit in large quantities so as to minimize the cost. She also recycles bottles and cardboard and then sells these materials to generate additional income.

In the future, María wants to see her children become professionals and to continue growing her business until it becomes one of the best establishments. She would like to express her appreciation to all of the Kiva lenders for her loan and to her Communal Bank for their support.

In the photo, María is wearing a gray pullover shirt and a cap.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Concepcion De Maria

texts.es:
Doña Concepción con 49 años de edad, originaria de Granada, casada, es madre de 7 hijos mayores de edad actualmente 1 de ellos esta estudiando su tercer año de secundaria, de oficio comerciante se dedica al negocio de pulpería, de la que es propietaria hace mas de 1 año, con conocimiento académico de quinto grado de primara. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio  a la edad de 19 años, vendiendo comida,  para obtener mejores ingresos, ya que no contaba con mucho dinero  para la manutención de  sus  hijos, fue asi que con las ganancias que le genero este negocio,  logro salir adelante con su familia, pero luego decidió emprender otro negocio como es el de la pulpería la cual le genera muchas ganancias, ella cuenta con otros ingresos como es el salario de su marido quien le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, sus expectativas es seguir ampliando su pulpería comprando productos que aun o tienen en existencia.
Solicito el crédito para comprar un  frízer  y insumos tales como frutas para sus bebidas, vegetales para hacer la ensalada, carne, arroz, gaseosa, etc, toda la materia prima para elaborar sus refrescos y sus platillos, el   frízer lo quiere para ofrecerle productos frescos a sus clientes, se siente satisfecha en el negocio pues le va bien mantiene sus ventas, sus planes futuro es llegar a convertir su pulpería en  una miscelánea para incrementar sus ventas y asi obtener buenas ganancias, su meta próxima es cancelar el préstamo para luego volver a solicitar otro para invertir en su negocio y mejorarlo dia a dia.
texts.en:
Concepción, 49, a native of the city of Granada, is married and mother to 7 children under 18 years old. Currently one of them is in their 3rd year of secondary school. She is a trader with 5 years of primary education, works in the small grocery store business, which she has owned for more than 1 year. 

Concepción started trading, selling food, at the age of 19 in order to gain a larger income as she didn't have a lot of money to raise her children. With the profits that this business generated, she succeeded in getting her family ahead, but she then decided to undertake another business, namely the small grocery store business, with which she gains a lot of profits. Concepción can count on other forms of income, such as her husband's salary which helps with the family's expenditure. She plans to continue expanding her small grocery store, buying the products which she doesn't stock yet.

She sought this loan to buy a freezer and goods such as fruits for her drinks, vegetables to make salad, meat, rice, fizzy drinks, etc., all the basic materials to make her drinks and dishes. Concepción wants the freezer to offer her customers fresh products, she is satisfied in the business as it is going well and sales are steady. Her future plans are to convert the small grocery store into a general store to increase her sales and thereby obtain better profits. Her next aim is to repay the loan to then seek another one to invest in her business and improve her day to day life.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and basic goods such as fruit for drinks, vegetables to make salad, meat, rice, fizzy drinks and so on.

loans.name: Reynaldo Severo

texts.es: Don Reynaldo, es muy conocido por su trabajo,  conocido por muchos choferes, quienes confían sus taxis y minibuses por su experiencia y conocimiento para la refacción de los mismos. Tiene 2 hijos jóvenes, que todavía viven a su lado, junto a su esposa, cariñosa madre dedicada a las labores de casa, quien todos los días espera a sus hijos de la escuela con el almuerzo listo y también a Don Reynaldo quien trabaja todo el día en su taller de mecánica automotriz. Conoció todo lo relacionado a vehículos porque desde muy joven trabajo en un taller de mantenimiento de vehículos de donde aprendió su oficio, del cual esta muy orgulloso, porque es su principal fuente de trabajo, que le  permite generar sus ingresos para mantener a su familia. El principal motivo por el que necesita del crédito es para abastecer su taller con nuevas herramientas, pues las otras ya tienen buen tiempo, y por el uso diario ya están gastadas. Tanto las herramientas como la gata hidráulica son imprescindible para el taller de don Reynaldo. Muy sonriente el Sr. Reynaldo menciona que sus hijos piensan seguir sus pasos pero desean estudiar Ingeniera Mecánica, y poder tener un gran Taller Automotriz.
texts.en: Reynaldo is well known for his work by many professional drivers, who trust their taxis and minibuses to his experience and knowledge. He has two young children who still live with he and his wife, a loving mother who dedicates herself to household tasks. She waits for the children every day coming home from school with lunch ready while Reynaldo works all day at his auto repair shop. Reynaldo knows everything there is to know about automobiles because he has worked in repair shops learning the trade since he was very young. This makes him very proud because it is his main source of income to provide for his family. He is requesting the loan to stock his shop with new tools, since he has had his current ones for some time and they are worn from daily use. These tools as wells as a hydraulic jack are essential to his shop. Reynoldo wears a big smile when he says that his children plan to follow in his footsteps, but they want to study mechanical engineering and have a big repair shop.

loans.use: to purchase tools and a hydraulic jack

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: La señora Ana María tiene 27 años está casada con el señor Juan Carlos, tienen dos hijos, donde el hijo mayor tiene una anomalía pues nació con la enfermedad de Hidrocefalia, esta situación es muy grave para la familia pues todo el tiempo tienen que estar al cuidado de su pequeño hijo. La señora Ana María y su familia viven en la comunidad de la Maica Sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba, gracias al trabajo duro de ambos lograron construir una pequeña casita en un terreno que les heredo la madre del señor Juan Carlos. La principal actividad de la señora Ana María es la producción de la leche cuenta con una buena cantidad de ganado lechero, el producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos. El destino del crédito es para la construcción de muralla para alojar el ganado, esto le favorecerá mucho ya que en esta temporada de lluvia su ganado estará protegido. Entre sus sueños y metas de la señora Ana María esta contar con buena salud para cuidar a su hijo enfermo y además incrementar el ganado hasta tener por lo menos 30 cabezas de ganado lechero y de esa manera contar con mejores ingresos para que sus dos hijos puedan tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Ana María is 27 years old and married to Juan Carlos. They have two children, and her eldest son was born with the birth defect hydrocephalus (too much fluid in the brain). This is a very grave situation for the family because at the same time they must care for their youngest son. Ana María and her family live in the community of Maica Sud in the city of Cochabamba. Thanks to her and her husband's hard work they were able to build a small home on land Juan Carlos inherited from his mother. Ana María makes a living in milk production with a good number of cows. She delivers the product to a business that makes dairy products. She plans to use the loan to build a wall to provide shelter to the livestock, which will help out a lot during this rainy season. Among her hopes and dreams are to be in good health so she can care for her sick son and to expand her livestock to at least 30 milk cows, and in this way she can have more income so her two children can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to build a wall to protect in her livestock.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
La Señorita Ana se encentra en el banco comunal Tres de Noviembre hace 2 años, en todo este tiempo ha afianzado la amistad con todas sus vecinas y amigas de la banca comunal, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar que goza de mucha vegetación y se puede admirar la belleza del campo, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo moderno y lo antiguo, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades.

La Señorita Ana tiene 25, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres la cual es propia, su padre labora como empleado privado y su madre labora en la agricultura. 

Ella se dedica la crianza de ganado la mayor parte de su tiempo, la leche que obtienes de su ganado lo vende, otros animales que cría son cuyes, pollos y cerdos a los que los vende en su comunidad. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ganados para continuar creciendo en este negocio. 

Su meta es de tener muchos más animales para la cría.
texts.en:
Ana has been in the Tres de Noviembre Communal Bank for 2 years. The entire time, she has strengthened the friendship with all of her female neighbors and friends at the communal bank. She lives by the parish of Cumbe in Cuenca, a place that has a lot of vegetation and where you can admire the beauty of the countryside. Its architecture is a mix of modern and antique. Its people make a living from raising animals, agriculture, and many work in the city in various businesses.

Ana is 25 years old, is single and lives with her parents in a house they own. Her father works as a private employee and her mother works in agriculture. 

She makes a living from raising cattle most of the time. She sells the milk that she obtains from her cattle. Other animals that she raises are guinea pigs, chickens and pigs, which she sells in her community.

She is going to invest her new loan in buying cattle to continue growing in this business.

Her goal is to have many more animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Ana Lourdes

texts.es:
La Señora Ana está realizando su cuarto crédito en el banco comunal Tres de Noviembre, banco comunal en el cual ha logrado llegar a atener muy buenas amigas y afianzar sus lasos de amistad con cada una de las socias,  vive por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar que goza de mucha vegetación y se puede admirar la belleza del campo, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo moderno y lo antiguo, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades.

La Señora. Ana tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 12, 10, 8 y 6 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus tres últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en  la que vive es  propiedad conyugal.

Doña Ana se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, como vive en el campo se dedica la crianza de cerdos, pollos y cuyes. También cultiva sus tierras y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar y si existe un sobrante lo vende. Hay veces que le llaman para que trabaje labrando tierras ajenas.

El nuevo crédito que realiza es para comprar pollos y alimento para todos sus animales.

Su meta es de agrandar su criadero de pollos, realizando galpones más grandes para la crianza.
texts.en:
Ana is making her fourth loan with the communal bank Tres de Noviembre, a communal bank which has brought about good friends and strengthened the ties of friendship among each of the members. She lives in the parish of Cumbe in Cuenca, a place with a lot of vegetation and one can admire the beauty of the countryside. Its architecture is a mixture of modern and old. Its people work in animal husbandry, agriculture and many work in the city in various activities.

Ana is 34 years old, married and has 4 children who are 12, 10, 8 and 6 years old. Her oldest child is a school student and her three youngest go to a local little school. Her husband works as a mason, and they own their own house where they live.

Ana takes care of the household chores, and as she lives in the country she works raising pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs. She also cultivates her land and the harvest is for household consumption and if she has any surplus she sells it. Sometimes she is asked to work on somebody else’s farm.

The new loan she is asking for is to buy chickens and animal feed for all the animals.

Her goal is to enlarge her chicken house, in order to have larger quarters for breeding.

loans.use: to buy chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La Señora María es una de las socias fundadoras del banco comunal Tres de Noviembre, en todo este tiempo ha logrado afianzar la amistad con todas sus amigas del grupo, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe en cuenca, lugar que goza de mucha vegetación y se puede admirar la belleza del campo, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo moderno y lo antiguo, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades.

Doña María tiene 50 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, cuatro de sus hijos son casados y viven independientes, sus dos hijos solteros estudian en un colegio de la localidad. Su esposo labora diariamente como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propiedad conyugal. 

Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de gallinas, cuyes y una gran variedad de animales, esta actividad la desempeña hace 20 años, también se dedica a la agricultura y su cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar y si existe un sobrante lo vende. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y gallinas.

Su meta es de tener más capital para invertir en su negocio de animales.
texts.en: María is one of the founding members of the Tres de Noviembre (November 3) community bank. In all that time she has been able to strengthen the bonds with her friends in the group. She lives in the parish of Cumbe in Cuenca, Ecuador, a place that enjoys a lot of admiration for its vegetation and the beauty of its countryside. The architecture is a mixture of the new and the old, and the people make a living in raising animals, farming or working in the city doing many different activities. María is 50 years old, married and has six children, four of whom are married and lives on their own. Her two single children study at a local school. Her husband works in construction and owns the family's home. María has made a living raising and selling chickens, guinea pigs and a wide variety of animals for the past 20 years. She also farms and uses her harvest to feed her family. If there is a surplus, she sells it. She plans to use the loan to purchase guinea pigs and chickens. Her goal is to have more capital to invest in her animal business.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: El Cruce Hacia El Futuro  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Cruce hacia el Futuro está conformado por 9 mujeres quienes son amigas y vecinas, viven por los alrededores de la parroquia Sinincay en Cuenca. Esta parroquia cuenta con una hermosa iglesia, sus paisajes son encantadores ya que existen muchos lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza. Sus habitantes son personas muy trabajadoras que laboran día a día en diferentes actividades económicas las mismas que le permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares y salir adelante, su carisma y alegría les caracterizan ya que a pesar de sus dificultades nunca dejan su buen humor, aun mantienen viva su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Mónica Patricia, está realizando su sexto crédito en conjunto con sus amigas y compañeras del banco comunal El Cruce hacia el Futuro, en este grupo ha encontrado una amistad incondicional de todas las socias y un buen compañerismo. Vive por el sector  El Cruce que pertenece a la parroquia de Sinincay.

La Señora Mónica Patricia tiene 36 años de edad, está separada de marido pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido dos hijos, su primera hija tiene 14 años de edad y está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, su segundo hijo tiene un año de edad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su madre con quien comparte los gastos de la casa.

Doña Mónica Patricia trabaja de lunes a viernes en una oficina como asistente de contadores, labora en esta actividad hace un año pero solo medio día, el resto de su tiempo lo dedica a su hogar y a la crianza y venta de animales como: pollos, cuyes y conejos. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes, conejos y alimento para animales.

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Cruce Hacia el Futuro is made up of 9 women who are friends and neighbors living in the outskirts of the parish Sinincay in Cuenca. This parish has a beautiful church, delightful landscapes and many places to enjoy nature. Its people are hardworking and work in various financial activities which permit them to pay household expenses and get ahead. Charisma and joy characterize them and despite their difficulties their good humor never leaves them, and they still maintain their culture and traditions.

One of the members of this group is Mónica Patricia who is making her sixth loan together with her friends and companions from the communal bank El Cruce Hacia el Futuro. This group has found unconditional friendship among its members and good camaraderie. She lives in the El Cruce area that belongs to the parish of Sinincay.

Mónica Patricia is 36 years old. She is separated from her husband and has two children from her marriage. Her oldest daughter is 14 years old and goes to school in the city, and her younger son is one year old. She does not have her own home but lives in her mother’s home with whom she shares the household expenses.

Mónica Patricia works from Monday through Friday in an office as an assistant bookkeeper. She has been working in the job for a year, working half a day. The rest of her time she works at home breeding and selling animals such as chickens, guinea pigs and rabbits.

She will use her new loan to invest in the purchase of chickens, guinea pigs, rabbits and animal feed for the animals.

Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, rabbits, and animal feed.

loans.name: Las Del Río  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las del Rio está formado por 6 mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día para sacar adelante a sus familias y mejorar su estabilidad económica, vive por la parroquia de Jadan en Cuenca,  lugar se encuentra rodeado por exuberante naturaleza y hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica la artesanía ya que elaboran sogas, también se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ana, conforma el banco comunal Las del Rio hace dos años y medio, tiempo en el que ha logrado afianzar sus lasos de amistad con todas las socias. 
 
La Señora Ana tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 17 y 11 años, su primera hija pasa en casa ayudando con los quehaceres del hogar, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que vive es su propia.
 
Ella la crianza de animales como: borregos, cerdos, gallinas y cuyes, tiene un invernadero en donde cultiva tomates para la venta, también se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar su invernadero. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser  buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Las del Rio communal bank is made up of 6 enterprising women who fight day to day to get their families ahead and improve their financial stability. They live in the Jadan parish of Cuenca, a place surrounded by natural beauty and beautiful landscapes. Its people work in artisanal crafts, making rope. They also work in farming and raise animals. 

One of the members of this group is Ana. She has been a member of the Las del Rio communal bank for two years and a half. During that time, se has been able to establish friendships with all of the members. 

Ana is 32 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 17 and 11. Her oldest daughter stays at home and helps with the household work, and her younger son goes to school. Her husband works as a bricklayer. They own the house they live in.
 
She raises animals such as: sheep, pigs, chickens and guinea pigs, She also has a greenhouse where she grows tomatoes to sell. She also farms and what she harvests is for household consumption. 

She will invest the money from the loan in buying construction materials to make some improvements on her greenhouse.

Her dream is for her children to have professional careers

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: María Ines

texts.es:
La señora María es una socia fundadora que del banco comunal Vegaspamba, vive por un sector muy conocido de la parroquia de Jadan en Cuenca, lugar se encuentra rodeado por exuberante naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la artesanía ya que elaboran sogas, también se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales. 

Doña María tiene 61 años de edad, esta casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos, todos sus hijos son mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, la casa en la que vive es  propia.
 
La Señora María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como vive en el campo labora en la agricultura, sus cosechas las vende y también son para consumo de su hogar. Cría y vende  cuyes, cerdos, borregos y ganado. Desde que era muy pequeña aprendió de sus padres la elaboración de sogas y esto le permite tener un ingreso extra en su hogar. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de piola para elaborar las sogas, abono para sus sembríos, cuyes y cerdos. 

Su meta es sacar adelante a toda su familia.
texts.en:
María is a founding member of the Vegaspamba communal bank.  She lives in a well-known part of the Jadan parish.  The area is surrounded by lush vegetation.  Its people devote themselves to crafts; they make ropes.  They also devote themselves to agriculture and raising animals.

María, age 61, is married, and she and her husband have nine children.  All of her children are grown, married, and live independently.  Her husband is a farmer, and she lives in her own house.

María devotes herself to the household chores.  As she lives in the countryside that works in farming, she sells her harvests.  Her harvests are also for her household’s consumption.  She raises and sells guinea pigs, pigs, sheep, and livestock.  When she was a very young girl she learned how to make ropes from her parents.  This allows her to have an extra income at home.

She will use the new loan to buy cord to make the ropes, natural fertilizer for her crops, guinea pigs, and pigs.

Her goal is to get her whole family ahead.

loans.use: to buy cord to make ropes, natural fertilizer for her crops, guinea pigs, and pigs.

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
La Señora. Luz es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que forma parte del banco comunal Vegaspamba. Vive por un sector muy conocido de la parroquia de Jadan lugar que se encuentra rodeado por exuberante naturaleza, su gente se dedica la artesanía ya que elaboran sogas, también se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales. 

La Señora. Luz tiene 42 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, dos de sus hijos trabajan y ayudan  económicamente, tres de sus hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad y tres  pasan en casa. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.
 
Doña Luz se dedica a la artesanía ya que desde muy niña se dedica a la elaboración de sogas, cría gallinas a las que las vende en su comunidad, también cultiva sus tierras y lo que cosecha es solo para el consumo de su hogar.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de piola para elaborar las sogas y gallinas.

Su meta es crecer en el negocio de las sogas.
texts.en:
Luz is a tenacious and enterprising woman who is a member of the Vegaspamba communal bank.  She lives in a well-known part of the Jadan parish.  The area is surrounded by lush vegetation.  Its people devote themselves to crafts; they make ropes.  They also devote themselves to agriculture and raising animals.

Luz, age 42, is married, and she and her husband have nine children.  Her eldest daughter is married and lives independently.  Two of her children work and help financially.  Three of her children go to the local school, and three of them stay at home.  Her husband works as a bricklayer.  They live in their own house.

Luz has been devoting herself to crafts ever since she was a very young girl.  She makes ropes and raises chickens that she sells in her community.  She also cultivates her land, and the harvest is only for her household’s consumption.

She will use the loan to buy cords for making ropes, and she will buy chickens.

Her goal is to grow in the rope business.

loans.use: to buy cord and chickens.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora María se encuentra conformando el banco comunal Vegaspamba hace 5 años, es una señora que busca el día a día el bienestar de su familia. Vive por un sector muy conocido de la parroquia de Jadan en Cuenca, lugar se encuentra rodeado por exuberante naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la artesanía ya que elaboran sogas, también se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales. 

La Señora María tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera de 7 hijos, un hijo es casado y vive independiente, cinco de sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, uno de sus hijos estudia en el colegio de la localidad. La casa en la que vive es el fruto de su trabajo.
 
Doña María se dedica a la agricultura, su cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar y si existe un sobrante lo vende, también cría y vende cuyes y gallinas. Elabora sogas ya que esta actividad es una tradición familiar. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para sus animales y piola para la elaboración de sogas. 

Su meta es tener más animales para la crianza.
texts.en:
María has been a member of the communal bank Vegaspamba for 5 years. She is a woman who seeks her family's well being every day. She lives in a well known area of the Jadan parish in Cuenca, a place surrounded by natural beauty. Its people works in artisanal crafts and they make rope. They also work in farming and raising animals. 

María is 51 years old. She is a single mother of 7 children. One son is married and lives on his own. Five of her children work and help her financially, and one of them goes to the local high school. The house where she lives is the fruit of her labors.
 
María works as a farmer. Her harvest is for household consumption and if any is left over she sells it. She also raises and sells guinea pigs and chickens. She makes rope, since that is a family tradition.

She is going to invest her new loan in buying feed for her animals as well as string to make rope with. Her goal is to have more animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy feed for animals as well as string.

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona is 42 years old and is married with 6 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years. Lona needs a loan to buy another wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, some bush-knives, a weedkiller spray, and more tiapula, as well as to improve her family assets. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Lona will use the profits from her sales to graduate her children from college.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, bush-knives, etc.

loans.name: Sareout's Group

texts.en:
Sareout resides in a rural area of Moung Russey District in Cambodia’s Battambang Province. He is 29 years of age and married with two dependent kids, one of whom is too young for school, while the other one is currently in school. To make a living, Sareout and his wife have been farming rice and planting beans so tirelessly for eight years, earning around 24,000 riels (KHR). After deducting the daily costs of living, they save approximately 18,000 KHR for future needs.

Sareout, a second-time borrower, is leading a group whose other member is just a first-time borrower with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. They are taking out a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR respectively. The group leader, Sareout, states that with the previous loan he was able to improve the living conditions of his family. This time, he will use his requested loan portion to pay the wages of his farm laborers. With the help of his loan, Sareout highly believes that he will be able to harvest rice and beans on time.

loans.use: to pay the wages of farm laborers

loans.name: Sopheoun's Group

texts.en:
A 31-year-old married woman named Sopheoun resides in a rural village of Moung Russey District in Battambang, Cambodia. She is blessed with a son who is too young to attend school. To continually support the family, Sopheoun and her husband have been farming rice on a two hectare plot of land and planting sesame on a hectare plot of land for five years. The current business can earn this hardworking couple around 22,000 riels (KHR) daily. 

This will be Sopheoun’s second time requesting a loan via Kiva’s partner VisionFund. The previous loan has enabled Sopheoun to meet the family’s needs and better support the family. Now she would like to expand her current business by buying more plots of land. Thus, Sopheoun is leading a group of two to apply for a loan in the amount of 2,200,000 KHR in total. After receiving and using the loan portion as she plans, Sopheoun believes that she will be able to increase her productivity generating more income for the family. In the future, she is willing to send her only son to a good school.

loans.use: to buy more plots of land

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en: Chanthou is 48 years old, married and a mother of four children, two of whom (a son and a daughter) still live at home and attend school. She lives in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, where she and her husband earn a decent life for the family by farming rice and planting corn. They have been in this line of work for about 10 years and earn about 45,000 KHR daily. Chanthou is requesting her third loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has successfully used her previous two loans to improve her family's life. She is requesting a new loan to pay for the cost of hiring people to help out on her farm. She leads a three-person loan group in which each member is requesting a loan for 1,000,000 KHR. She believes that this loan will give her a better crop and help her advance the education of her school-aged children.

loans.use: to hire workers to help on a farm.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en: Touch, 59 years old, lives in Cambodia in a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She is married and the mother of three children. Touch and her husband have been farming rice and planting sesame tirelessly for the last ten years to support their family. Each day, they are able to earn approximately 49,000 KHR through their hard work. This will be Touch’s third request for a loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She was very satisfied with her prior two loans because they helped her meet her family’s needs. Now, Touch is leading a group of three people who seek a loan for 4,000,000 KHR. Touch will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for the cost of hiring people to help her with her crop. She believes  that this loan will give her a good-quality harvest which will allow her to earn more money to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and to pay for the cost of hiring helpers.

loans.name: Bunly's Group

texts.en: Bunly is a 51-year-old widow who lives in a rural village in Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, where she earns a living by farming rice. She has been in this line of work for more than 25 years and earns around 25,000 KHR per day. Of this sum, she is able to save 13,000 KHR daily after paying her expenses. Bunly has completed 11 loan cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and has successfully used these loans to pay her daily expenses and improve her lifestyle. She now leads a five-person loan group whose members are requesting 1,000,000 KHR each. She plans to use her portion of the loan to pay for the cost of hiring workers to help on her farm. Bunly hopes to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to hire workers to help on a farm.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom, aged 62 years, is a villager in the Kandal Stoeng district in Cambodia’s Kandal Province. She is a widow and a mother of nine children. 

This single mother works so many jobs to support the family. She farms rice and sells porridge and Khmer noodles, which enables her to earn approximately 29,000 KHR per day and save about 16,000 KHR after canceling out the daily expenses. 

Sokhom has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for twelve loan cycles already. With these loans, she accomplished strengthening her current businesses by increasing her working capital and securing food needs for her family. 

Now Sokhom is leading a group of six female members to take out a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. The group representative, Sokhom, will spend her loan portion on paying wages to farm laborers. This industrious single mother hopes to generate more income for the family and better support the family.

loans.use: to pay wages to farm laborers.

loans.name: Aen's Group

texts.en: Residing in a rural area of the Srey Snom district in Cambodia’s Siem Reap province, Aen is a 60-year-old widow. She is a single mother of seven children, one (a son) of whom is under her responsibility and currently in school. To support the family, Aen works as a rice farmer on a 1.5 hectare (3.7 acre) plot of farmland. She earns about 5,000 KHR each day and saves approximately 2,500 KHR after paying her daily expenses. Aen, a second-time borrower, is leading a group of two. Aen and the group's other member, who is just a first-time borrower, request loans in the amount of 400,000 KHR and 100,000 KHR, respectively, for a total of 500,000 KHR. Her earlier loan enabled Aen to better meet her family’s needs. This time, she will utilize her portion of the loan to pay for the cost of labor. Single mother Aen expects her portion of the loan to help her to harvest her rice on time.

loans.use: To pay for the cost of labor

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Saveoun's Group

texts.en:
Saveoun, 38, is married and blessed with four dependent kids, three of whom are school-aged and one who is too young. She is a citizen in the Moung Russey district in Cambodia’s Battambang province. To support their family, Saveoun and her husband have been farming rice and sesame for the past ten years. They earn about 30,000 KHR each day. 

Saveoun is requesting a 3,800,000 KHR group loan through the Kiva partner VisionFund to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs. She is the leader of a three-woman loan group and this will be her fourth loan. Her past loans have enabled her to better support her family. Saveoun will use her loan to improve the quality of her crop yield and boost her income. In the future, she plans to advance her children's education and send her youngest kid to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs

loans.name: Sareoun

texts.en:
Sareoun is a 32-year-old married woman with four dependent kids, two of whom are school-aged and two who are too young to attend school. She and her family live in a rural village of Moung Russey district in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sareoun and her husband are farmers who support their family by planting rice and sesame. Sareoun’s husband also has a fishing business. Together, this industrious couple earns approximately 39,000 KHR each day. 

Sareoun is requesting a 4,000,000 KHR loan through the Kiva partner VisionFund to buy more plots of land. She has received two previous loans that she used to improve her family's standard of living. Sareoun will use her loan to increase her farm's productivity and provide more income for her family. In the future, she hopes to provide for her children's higher education and send her younger children to school.

loans.use: to buy farmland

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy is 31 years old, married, and mother to three dependent children. She is a villager living in the Moung Ressey district in Battambang province, Cambodia. Two of Thy’s children are school-aged while the other is too young for school. For the past ten years, Thy and her husband have supported their family by working as rice farmers. They earn approximately 33,000 KHR each day and are able to save about 20,000 KHR after covering their daily expenses. Thy has received six previous loans through VisionFund and has succeeded in improving her family's living standards. 

Thy is requesting a group loan of 3,600,000 KHR. She is the leader of a three-person loan group and will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer to help keep her rice field in good shape. She expects to improve the quality of her harvest and boost her income. In the future, she will use the anticipated profit from her loan to advance her beloved children's education and continue to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
Sor is 43 years old and the widowed mother of four children, one of whom is dependent on her. She lives in a rural village of the Pursat province’s Sampov Meas district. For the past several years, Sor has worked as a rice farmer and her family's income comes from leasing a 1.5 hectare rice paddy.  She earns about 10,000 KHR each day and she manages to save about 4,000 KHR daily for the future. Sor has received three previous loans through VisionFund that she used to improve her rice paddy. She successfully repaid her loans.

Sor is the leader of a four-person loan group. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her paddy and also to buy piglets to raise and sell. In the future, she hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha is 39 years old and married with one daughter who is still in school. She lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. Sokha earns a living selling rice soup and her husband is a solider to earn income to help support their family. Together, she and her husband can earn about 28,000 KHR each day and are able to save about 10,000 KHR daily for the future. Sokha has received three previous loans through VisionFund that have helped her to relieve her family's burden and improve their livelihood. She has successfully repaid her previous loans.

Sokha is the leader of a four-member group loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy spices to make rice soup to sell. In the future, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family's living conditions and keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: to buy spices to make rice soup to sell

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat is 49 years old and the married mother of four children, two of whom are dependents. Her dependent children work as mechanics to help support the family. Sinat lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Sangke district. Her family earns an income from rice farming and sometimes working for others for a fee. Sinat has been a farmer for the past ten years. She earns about 46,000 KHR each day and is able to save about 10,000 KHR daily for future needs. Sinat has received five previous loans through VisionFund that she has used to improve the living standards of her family. She has successfully repaid her loans. 

Sinat is the group leader of a four-person loan group. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and also to buy spare parts for her children's business. In the future, she hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy ferilizer and spare parts for her children's business

loans.name: Sokly's Group

texts.en:
Sokly is 24 years old and married with one son who is too young for school. She lives in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. For the last six years, Sokly has been farming rice on four-hectare plot of farmland to provide the primary source of her family’s income. Sometimes, her husband works for others for a fee. Sokly and her husband can earn about 18,000 KHR daily and they manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after expenses. Her major business challenge is the lack of water. She has received two previous loans with VisionFund and her fellow group member has received four previous loans. Sokly has successfully repaid her loans.

Sokly is the leader of a group loan request. She will use her portion of the loan to rent a harvesting machine to help with her rice paddy harvest. Sokly hopes to get a high yield from her farmland to improve her living standards and send her son to school.

loans.use: to rent a harvesting machine to help with her rice harvest

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Phal, 41, is married with five children and resides in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Two of her children are dependents and still in school. To support the family, she has been farming rice for ten years while her husband works as a worker to gain more income to better support the family. Together, they can earn about KHR 21,000 per day and can save about KHR 6,000 each day for their future needs.

Phal has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles. She fully repaid the loans which have helped her to relieve her family’s burden. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying soil to refill her house. Phal hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district, Sim is aged 44 years and widowed with five children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school.

She earns a living through planting vegetables such as cabbages, chilies and water convolvulus (water spinach), etc. Having been in this business for five years, she manages to earn about 21,000 KHR per day and can save about 8,000 KHR each day for their future needs.

This is a group loan for Sim’s group of three who live in the same village. Sim has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Sim wants to use her portion to buy a plot of farmland to grow water convolvulus. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to better her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland to grow water convolvulus

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Nget is aged 51 years and married. She has five children to take care of and one of them is a dependent and still in school.

To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer on four-hectares of farmland for seven years and she also raises pigs to better feed her children. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day.

Nget has been a member of VisionFund for three loan cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her to better support her family with enough food. Now she is asking for a new loan of 2,600,000 KHR to buy feeds for nourishing pigs. Nget hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price to increase her family’s income and make a living better.

loans.use: to buy feeds for nourishing pigs

loans.name: Kimneang's Group

texts.en:
Kimneang is 30 years old and married with one son. She lives with her family in a village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. For the past 12 years, Kimneang and her husband have been farming rice on five-hectare farmland to provide the main source of her family’s income. This is her first loan with VisionFund.

Kimneang is leading her three-member group to apply for a 1,000,000 KHR for each member. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. Kimneang hopes to grow her rice timely and fruitfully and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
Channa is 25 years old, married, and blessed with two dependent daughters. She is a villager in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district in Cambodia. For the past ten years, Channa has been a rice farmer and her family's income comes from a four-hectare plot of land. She generates about 18,000 KHR daily. Channa has received a previous loan through the Kiva partner VisionFund that she used to improve her family's lifestyle. 

Channa is the representative of a group requesting a 1,200,000 KHR and 1,400,000 KHR loan. She will use her portion of the loan to pay labor costs. Channa is an industrious woman who hopes that her loan will increase her productivity and the quality of her harvest. In the future, she hopes to improve her crop yields and increase her family's income and profit.

loans.use: to pay labor costs

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Son is 41 years old. She earns a living through farming rice, while her husband works as a solider. Engaging in this business for 20 years together, they can earn about 39,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day from the current business and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Son has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles and completely paid back the past loan, which helped her to better support her family with enough food. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. Son is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland.
