texts.en: Group formed by three entrepreneurial women partners. One of them is Miriam, who has had a small grocery store for the last 20 years. She is a married woman with a 19-year-old son. Her husband and her son help her with the administration of the business. The loan will be invested in buying basic grains like rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, laundry detergent, dairy products, beef, chicken, etc. Fabiola sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics from Avon, and María Engracia sells various cosmetics from Avon, clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to invest in buying basic grains like rice, beans, sugar, oil, dairy products, beef, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Pillao Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PILLAO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yanet  ella es conviviente, tiene 32 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes  que le solicitan, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la carpinteria, venta de verduras, fabrica de ladrillos, bar, crianza de animales menores, venta de chicha, venta de comida.
La persona que aparece con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “PILLAO”.  This communal bank is located in Cusco District, which belongs to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

Yanet is a member of this communal bank. She is 32 years old, lives with her partner and has two children. She divides her time between her daily activities and raising small animals for sale, such as guinea pigs and chickens. She has been in this business for years, which does well for her thanks to the hard work she puts in every day. She raises these small animals to sell them to her customers, in this way providing for her family.

Yanet is requesting this loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.  The other members of the communal bank work at carpentry, selling vegetables, brick-making, snackbars, raising small animals, selling chicha (a fermented corn-based drink) and selling other foods.

The person whose face is covered in the photo does not belong to the communal bank.

Yanet is grateful to all those who form part of her dream in this way, and she promises to make her payments in the period established for her loan.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Martha Maria

texts.es: Martha es una microempresaria de éxito que se dedica a vender electrodomésticos en menor escala, perfume, ropa, zapatos, es casada y tiene 4 hijos menores de edad. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de electrodomésticos menor escala como horno, licuadoras, abanicos, planchas, cosméticos variados de la Avon, ropa, zapato etc.
texts.en:
Martha is a successful micro-entrepreneur who makes a living selling small appliances, perfume, clothing, and shoes.  She's married and has four minor children.

She's going to invest the loan in buying small appliances such as an oven, blenders, fans, irons, and a variety of Avon cosmetics, clothing, shoes, etc.

loans.use: to buy appliances, cosmetics, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel es una mujer emprendedora de éxito su negocio es vender cosméticos de la Avon, ropa desde hace 10 años. Es acompañada y tiene dos hijos de 20 y 16 años de edad quienes le ayudan a vender sus productos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos de la Avon  variado, zapatos, perfumen.
texts.en:
María Isabel is a successful entrepreneur.  Her business for 10 years has been selling Avon cosmetics and clothing.  She has a partner and two children, ages 10 and 16, who help her sell her products.

She'll invest the loan in buying a variety of Avon cosmetics, shoes, and perfume.

loans.use: to buy Avon cosmetics, perfume, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Choquequirao Inc Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Choquequirao INC” en la ciudad del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de ropa, confección de ropa, venta de productos naturales, venta de comida, brindar servicio de seguridad, profesores, odontólogos y empleados públicos.    

Milagros nació en la provincia del Cusco y vive en la misma provincia donde nació. Su actividad económica de Milagros es la venta de fajas por catalalogos, ella ofrece los productos a sus amigos, vecinos, familiares, compañeros del banco comunal, una vez hecho el pedido del producto,  ella tiene que pedir los productos con su dinero para luego las personas que pidieron le paguen el valor del producto o en cuotas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.       En esta oportunidad Milagros  requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos como fajas. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. (La persona que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografia pidio permiso para no estar presente en la reunion).
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the Choquequirao Inc. communal bank in the city of Cusco.  This communal bank is made up of people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and, with their daily effort, give their children a better future.  The work the members carry out includes selling clothing, making clothing, selling natural products, selling food, offering security services, teaching, dentistry, and working as a public employee.

Milagros was born in the province of Cusco and lives in the same province.  Milagros's job is selling belts via catalogue.  She sells the products to her friends, neighbors, relatives, and coworkers in the communal bank.  Once they order the product, she has to order it with her money and later the customers pay her the product's value or make payments.  She has made a living in this business for several years and it's going very well for her.

Milagros needs this loan to buy more products, such as belts.

The members in general are grateful for this opportunity and are committed to making their various payments punctually.  (The person who appears at the bottom of the photograph asked permission to not attend the meeting.)

Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco and the department of Cusco, right in the heart of the ancient capital of the Incas.  It's known as  a tourist region for its archeological centers, historic city center, scenery, and history, and for being a charming city in the southern part of the country.  Cusco's known for tourism, commerce, and the traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World is there, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy belts

loans.name: Qorilazo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORILAZO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elena ella es casada y tiene 34 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboración de comida, la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria repartiendo su comida en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para su negocio como arroz, aceite, menestras  entre otros.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de comida,tienda de abarrotes, venta de choclo con queso, venta de mates,brindando servicio de taxi,crianza de animales menores.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the QORILAZO community bank live in Cusco, a city in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Sra. Elena, 34, is married and has 4 children.  She operates a food sales business, making prepared food and selling what she makes at a market in Cusco.  She has operated the business for several years and says that it is successful because she has worked day in and day out to make it successful.  She is a responsible person, driven to make a success of the business because it is her means of supporting her family.

Sra. Elena is applying for a loan that she will use to buy supplies for her business: rice, cooking oil, etc.

The bank's other members operate a range of businesses that include food sales, grocery sales, mate sales, taxi services and sales of farm animals.

Sra. Elena is grateful to everyone who has supported her and committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her retail food business.

loans.name: Orn's Group

texts.en:
Orn, 45 years old, lives in a rural area of Moung Russey district in Cambodia's Battambang province. She is married and a mother of four children, one (a daughter) who is dependent on her and currently in school.

To make a living, Orn works as a rice farmer on a two-hectare plot of farmland while her husband supplements the income by working as a paid worker. Together, they are able to earn 24,000 KHR daily and manage to save approximately 18,000 KHR after offsetting the daily cost of living. 

This will be Orn's fourth time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The previous loans have enabled her to secure her family's finances. Orn is now leading a female group member who is a first-time borrower to take out loans in the amount of 1,400,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR respectively. As a group representative, Orn will spend her loan portion on covering the cost of labor and also spend a small portion of the loan on covering the cost of transportation to join her child's wedding in Phnom Penh (the capital city of Cambodia), as well as helping to celebrate the wedding party. Via the help of this loan portion, Orn believes that her rice will be harvested on time and is able to successfully help her child celebrate their wedding.

loans.use: to cover the cost of labor.

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en: At 29 years old, Thea is a citizen living in Battambang province's Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She is married and blessed with two dependent kids, one of whom is a student while the other one is too young for schooling. Thea and her husband offer decent conditions for the family by working as rice farmers. To add more income to the family, Thea's husband also works as a motor-taxi driver. Together, they generate income for the family around 25,000 KHR per day. Thea has been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, for four loan cycles already, with which she succeeded in improving the family's lifestyle. She is now leading a group member who has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles to seek loans in the amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. The group leader, Thea, will utilize her loan portion to pay wages to farm laborers. Thea expects to harvest rice on time via the help of this loan.

loans.use: to pay wages to farm laborers.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Living in a rural village of Pursat province's Kror Kor district in Cambodia, Sophea is 27 years of age and married. She has a daughter who is still dependent on her and too young to attend school. Sophea and her husband support the family through designing wedding invitation cards. Most of her clients are local residents. The lack of working capital has been a big challenge for her business. Sophea is now seeking a KHR 2,000,000 loan for the first time with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) to purchase a photocopier machine to support her business. Sophea hopes to smoothly operate her business and generate more income for her family. This industrious mother is also willing to utilize her anticipated income to send her only daughter to a good school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopier machine.

loans.name: Aswan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Aswan and consists of four ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen.

Faten, 32, lives with her husband and their six children in Taiz -Yemen. She is a leader of the Aswan Group. 

Faten wants to start her project of raising and selling sheep and sheep products. It is a profitable business, but she also needs more support to cover the family's needs. Faten has applied for a loan from AMB to help her and her family to cover the costs of purchasing and raising sheep. 

Faten is very ambitious lady. She is thinking and looking in the near future to expand her business and improve the herd's condition.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to raise.

loans.name: Sabola Group

texts.en:
This group is called Sabola, which consists of 4 ladies who live in Sana'a, Yemen. 

Aziah is 43 years old, married, and has nine children who live in Sana'a. She is a hardworking house wife. She applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy home appliances to use for the house. She hopes to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy home appliances to use for the house.

loans.name: Wara Wara Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento WARA WARA está  compuesto por nueve  integrantes ocho mujeres y un varon,  la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. Felicidad tiene 56 años,  ella se dedica  a la pesca y venta de pescado su esposo es pescador y ella comercializa el pescado que su esposo pesca en el lago Titicaca,  ellos viven en el estrecho de Tiquina una localidad cerca del lago Titicaca del  departamento de La Paz,  la mayoría de los habitantes de esta localidad  se dedican a la pesca y el turismo,   este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Felicidad va a usar este préstamo para la compra de redes para la pesca, el producto de su pesca lo venden en la ciudad de La Paz y con este red quiere incrementar su producción y así satisfacer la demandada de sus clientes, la Sra. Felicidad es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que tienen para mantenerse.
texts.en: The WARA WARA communal bank is made up of nine members, eight women and one man. The president of the bank is Felicidad. She is 56 years old and works fishing and selling fish. Her husband is a fisherman and she sells the fish that her husband fishes in Lake Titicaca. They live in the Tiquina straits in a community close to Lake Titicaca in the department of La Paz. Most of the residents of this community work in fishing and tourism. This loan is her first cycle with the institution. Felicidad is going to use this loan to buy fishing nets. They will sell the product in the city of La Paz and with this net she wants to increase her production and thus satisfy her customers' demand. Felicidad is a person who wants to get ahead. She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support it has offered, since this is the only source of income that they have to support themselves.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: El Buen Pastor Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento EL BUEN PASTOR está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. Maria tiene 23 años,  casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 2 y 6 años,  la Sra. Maria se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de higiene y limpieza como champó jabón, jaboncillos, peines y toallas y variedad de artículos en su puesto de venta  que se encuentra ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de El Alto, ella es cliente que se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de artículos de limpieza para surtir su negocio y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Maria va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en: The EL BUEN PASTOR community bank has eight members: six women and two men.  The president of the community bank, Sra. Maria, is 23-years old and married with two children, 6- and 2-years old, respectively.  Sra. Maria operates a retail business.  She sells a variety of toiletries including shampoo, soap, combs, towels, etc.  She operates the business in a market in the city of El Alto.  She is a new customer of the institution.  Sra. Maria will use this loan to stock her business with the products that she sells.  The investment will allow her to provide a variety of products to her customers.  She says that she wants to continue improving her business and that she will use the profits from the investment to buy more products and ultimately increase her income.

loans.use: to stock her retail toiletries business.

loans.name: Om Khalid Group

texts.en: This group is called Om Khalid. It consists of three women who reside in the same area. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. This group has requested financial aid from AMB to boost their business. They have requested a loan of 140,000 YER. The group's representative, Jamila, is 35 years old and lives in Sana`a. She works to cover the different household expenses. To help meet the different needs of the family, she is a tailor. This business enables her to support herself without much trouble. She gets her supplies from the city market. Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, she is asking for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy a sewing machine. She hopes to expand her business to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: G.s Lajero Blancon#5 Group

texts.es:
La señora Sayda es una persona honesta responsable y muy trabajadora vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la compra y venta de carne y verduras. 
Doña Sayda el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de hueso, costilla, sancocho, carne molida, repollo, pataste, mínimo verde, yuca, papas, zanahorias, etc.  Con el préstamo ella espera que sus ventas aumenten al tener  más producto que ofrecer a los clientes y así satisfacer sus necesidades y así  poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia  con el aumento de sus ingresos. 
Doña Sayda en unos años espera que su negocio crezca y sea uno de los más reconocidos de la comunidad y así poder seguir  apoyando a sus hijos para que continúen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades.
La Señora María tiene 33 años de edad  su negocio  es la venta de tamales desde y tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad.
La Señora Bernardina tiene 34 años de edad su negocio es una mini pulpería que tiene desde hace 3 años. 
La Señora Marlen tiene 36 años de edad su negocio es la sastrería desde hace 8 años. 


Choluteca, Honduras – Diciembre 2012
texts.en:
Sra. Sayda is a hard-working, responsible person.  She lives in southern Honduras with her husband and 2 children.  She operates a retail foods business, buying and selling meats and vegetables.  
Dona Sayda will use the loan to buy inexpensive cuts of meat, including ribs and ground beef, along with cabbage, yucca, potatoes, carrots, etc.  She hopes the investment will allow her to provide more products to her customers and, in turn, increase her income.  
Dona Sayda wants to grow her business and see it become one of the community's best known businesses.  Building a successful business will allow her to continue supporting her children and paying for their education.  
Sra. Maria, 33, has operated a tamales sales business for more than 10 years.
Sra. Bernardina, 34, has operated a corner grocery for 3 years.
Sra. Marlen, 36, has opererated a tailoring business for 8 years.

Choluteca, Honduras - December 2012

loans.use: to stock her retail food business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos  tiene 53 años vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con el vive su esposa quien le apoya en su actividad y en cada una de sus responsabilidades.
Don Carlos  su negocio es venta de frutas, verduras y legumbres actividad que realiza desde hace 15 años en su ciudad donde vive, su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico porque está en el centro  de su ciudad y esto hace que sea muy visitado por sus clientes.
Don Carlos el crédito lo necesita para la compra de banano, tomate, lechuga, ayote, jilote, remolacha, uvas, manzanas, melón,piñas,ajos etc. Espera que sus ventas crezcan al comprara más variedad de producto y de esta manera satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes los cuales le visitan a diario.
Don Carlos vende productos que son de muy buena calidad y sus planes a futuro es seguir creciendo en su actividad comercial y ser uno de los mejores en su región y de esta manera generarse ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida con su familia.



Choluteca, Honduras - Diciembre  del 2012
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos, 53, lives with his wife in southern Honduras.  His wife helps him with his business and every other way, too.
Don Carlos has operated a retail fruits and vegetables business in his town for 15 years.  He operates the business in a good location, right in the middle of the town, and the business is well known in the area. 
Don Carlos will use the loan to buy bananas, tomatoes, lettuce, pumpkins, corn, cabbage, grapes, apples, melons, pineapples, garlic, etc.  He hopes the investment will help him to meet the demands of his customers and, in turn, increase his revenues.  
Don Carlos sells good quality products.  For the future, he wants to grow the business and see it become one of the best known in the area.  Building a successful business will allow him to generate the income he needs to provide a better quality of life for his family.

Choluteca, Honduras - December 2012

loans.use: to stock his retail fruits and vegetables business.

loans.name: Ibrahan

texts.es:
El Señor Ibrahan de 45 años, vive con su esposa y su  hijo en su casa de habitación en una colonia de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 15 años a venta de hamacas de hilo y seda y tiene de varios tamaños, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa, que está a la orilla de la carretera panamericana  sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan
Don Ibrahan está solicitando el préstamo  para la compra de  Hamacas de Hilo, seda y de lona de diferentes tipos, quiere compra al por mayor y para obtener más ganancias.
Don Ibrahan con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para su negocio y  de igual forma mejorar sus ingresos.
Don Ibrahan su sueño es comprarse un carro para poder transportarse a todos lados.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del 2012.
texts.en:
Sr. Ibrahan, 45, lives in San Lorenzo, a town in southern Honduras, with his wife and son.  He has operated a retail hammocks business for 15 years.  He sells various sizes of hammocks made from linen and silk.  He lives near the Panamerican Highway and operates the business from his house.  His customers are mostly local people.  
Don Ibrahan is applying for a loan that he will use to buy different kinds of linen, silk and canvas hammocks.  He wants to stock the hammocks from a wholesaleer so that he keep the extra margin.  
Don Ibrahan says that the loan will provide the financing that he needs for the business and ultimately increase his income.  
For the future, Don Ibrahan wants to buy a vehicle that he can use to transport his hammocks to wherever he needs to carry them.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - December 2012

loans.use: to stock his retail hammock business.

loans.name: Azucena Altagracia

texts.es:
La señora  Azucena de 46 años de edad, es casada  tiene  un   hijo  que depende de ella, se dedica desde hace 25 años al negocio de venta de frescos, pollo, embutidos, agua en bolsa, churros, dulces, verduras, cosméticos, granos básicos, medicina y pan su negocio está ubicado en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Doña Azucena  es una mujer que ha trabajado duro para sacar adelante a su familia está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de abarrotería como ser: jabones, churros, frescos, frijoles, arroz, café, azúcar, manteca, refrescos, agua,  dulces, pan y verduras  que son los productos que más se le venden en esta época, con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
 Doña Azucena su sueño es tener un buen negocio y mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del 2012
texts.en:
Azucena, age 46, is married and has one child who is dependent upon her.  For 25 years she has had the business of selling soft drinks, chicken, sausages, bags of water, churros, candy, vegetables, cosmetics, basic grains, medicine, and bread.  Her business is located in the San Lorenzo community in southern Honduras.

Azucena is a woman who has worked hard in order to get her family ahead.  She is requesting a loan in order to buy grocery products like soaps, churros, soft drinks, beans rice, coffee, sugar, shortening, water, candy, bread, and vegetables.  These are the products that she sells the most of during this season.  With the support of this loan she intends to improve her income, and she will consequently improve her quality of life.

Azucena’s dream is to have a good business and to improve her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras  December, 2012

loans.use: to buy soaps, churros, soft drinks, beans rice, coffee, sugar, shortening, water, candy, bread, and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Tocte  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Tocte es un banco comunal que se encuentra formado por 7 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Jadan en Cuenca,  este lugar se encuentra rodeado por exuberante naturaleza que nos regalan hermosos paisajes. Su gente se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades. Aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Zoila,  forma parte del banco comunal Tocte hace 4 años, en todo este tiempo llegado a conocer más a sus vecinas y amigas afianzando mucho más los lasos de su amistad.
 
La Señora María Zoila tiene 55 años, es casada y en fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos quienes todos son mayores de edad, seis de sus hijos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja y también vive independiente. Su esposo trabaja diariamente en la agricultura, la casa en la que vive es propia.

Ella trabaja arduamente cada día en las actividades del campo, cultiva sus terrenos y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar y si existe un sobrante lo vende. Cría y vende cuyes, gallinas, cerdos y ganado. También  se dedica a la elaboración de sogas.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono, cuyes, gallinas y cerdos. 

Su meta es mejorar sus potreros tener más animales.
texts.en:
Tocte is a communal bank that is made up of 7 women and 1 man who live in the outskirts of Cuenca's Jadan parish.  This is a place that is surrounded by lush flora and fauna, providing beautiful landscapes.  The people here work in farming and animal husbandry, and many work in the city in a variety of occupations.  The people here still maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

One of the members of this group is Maria Zoila.  She has been a member of the Tocte communal bank for 4 years.  Over this time, she has gotten to know her neighbors and friends better, strengthening the bonds of their friendship.

Maria Zoila is 55 years old, married, and has 7 children who are all grown.  Six of her children are married and live independently.  Her single son works and also lives independently.  Her husband works each day in agriculture, and they live in their own home.

Maria Zoila works arduously each day on farming activities and cultivating her land.  Her harvests are mainly destined for her family's consumption; if there is a surplus, then she will sell it.  She also raises guinea pigs, hens, pigs and cows, and she has a business making rope.

With this new loan, she will invest in the purchase of organic fertilizer, guinea pigs, hens and pigs.

Maria Zoila's goal is to improve her pastureland and have more animals.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer, guinea pigs, chickens and pigs

loans.name: Gladys Suzana

texts.es:
La Señora. Gladys esta reingresando al banco comunal Damas Responsables, vive por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera de mayor importancia económica del país, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente son personas amables, gentiles y de un corazón cálido, aun mantienen vivas las llamas de su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Gladys tiene 41 años, es casada y ha concebido 2 hijos de 18 y 16 años, su primer hijo se dedica a trabajar y le ayuda economícamente, su segundo hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo tiene un taller de carpintería y tapicería, la casa en la que viven es propia.
 
La Señora. Gladys desde hace 15 años labora en el negocio familiar el cual les ayuda a superarse y mejorar su estabilidad económica, en el taller de su esposo se dedican a elaborar muebles de todo tipo, trabajan de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de madera, pinturas, pega, clavos y otros materiales para el taller. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser unos buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gladys is rejoining the communal bank Damas Responsables (Responsible Ladies).  She lives in a beautiful sector of the city of Cuenca.  This city is the third most important economically in the country.  Since 1999 it has been honored with the title of World Heritage Site (Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad).  The people of Cuenca are kind, gentle, and have a warm heart.  They keep the flames of their culture and tradition alive.  

Gladys is 41 years old, is married, and has two children ages 18 and 16.  Her oldest son works and helps her economically.  Her second child is studying at college in the city.  Her husband has a carpentry and upholstery shop.  They live in their own home.

Gladys has worked in the family business for 15 years.  It has helped her achieve success and economic stability.  In her husband's shop they make all kinds of furniture.  They work from Monday to Saturday without a fixed schedule.  In her free time she works selling cosmetics.  

She will invest her loan in puchasing wood, paint, glue, nails and other materials for the shop.

Her dream is that her children will become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, glue, nails and other materials for her furniture shop.

loans.name: María Tania

texts.es:
La Señora María está cursando el segundo crédito con sus amigas y compañeras que conforman el banco comunal Damas Responsables, le gusta mucho estar en este banco comunal ya que todas las socias son unidas y solidarias. Vive por un hermoso sector de  la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera de mayor importancia económica del país, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente son personas amables, gentiles y de un corazón cálido, aun mantienen vivas las llamas de su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora María tiene 31 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, su primera hija tiene 10 años de edad se encuentra estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad y su segundo hijo tiene 1 año de edad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive con sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos de la casa.
 
Ella trabaja desde hace 10 años como secretaria, laborando de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo, en su casa también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y alimento para los mismos.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
María is requesting her second loan with her friends and group mates that together form the communal bank "Damas Responsables" [Responsible Women].  She very much likes to be a part of this communal bank, since all of the members are united and supportive.  

She lives in a beautiful area of the city of Cuenca.  This city is third most important economic city of the country and has been a Cultural Heritage site since December 1999.  Its people are kind, gentle, warm-hearted, and they still keep their culture and old traditions alive.

María is thirty-one years old, and is a single mother of two children.  Her oldest, a daughter, is ten years old and is studying in the small school in the neighborhood.  Her youngest, a son, is one year old.  She does not have her own house, and she lives with her parents; they share the home expenses.  

She has worked for ten years as a secretary, working from Monday to Friday without a fixed schedule.  In her home, she also makes a living in raising pigs.

She will invest her new loan money in the purchase of pigs and the food for the pigs.

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy pigs and food for the pigs.

loans.name: Miriam Catalina

texts.es:
La Señora Miriam es una socia que forma parte del banco comunal Damas Responsables, le gusta estar en el banco comunal ya que todas las socias son amigas y vecinas. Vive por un hermoso sector de  la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera de mayor importancia económica del país, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente son personas amables, gentiles y de un corazón cálido, aun mantienen vivas las llamas de su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Miriam tiene 35 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 12 años de edad que está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es empleado privado, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Ella se dedica al comercio de productos naturales y a la cría y venta de animales, esta actividad le permite tener su independencia económica, ayuda en la economía de su hogar y sobre todo tiene el tiempo necesario para cuidar de su familia. 
P>
Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de ganado del cual ha obtenido muy buenos ingresos, en la cancelación de dicho crédito lo ha realizado en las fechas correspondientes sin dificultad alguna. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos, cuyes, alimento para animales y productos naturales ya que es un buen negocio y ya cuenta con clientela,
texts.en:
Miriam is a member of the Damas Responsables communal bank.  She likes being in the communal bank because all of the members are friends and neighbors.  She lives in a beautiful part of the city of Cuenca.  This city is the third most financially important in the country.  It has been a World Heritage Site since 1999.  The people are friendly, gracious, and warm-hearted.  They still maintain their culture and traditions.

Miriam is 35 years old, married, and has a 12-year-old son who is studying at a school in the city. Her husband is privately employed, and they live in their own house. 

She devotes herself to selling natural products and raising and selling animals.  This business activity allows her to be financially independent and helps her household financially.  Most of all, it allows her to have the time she needs to take care of her family.

She used her previous loan to buy livestock, and she has gotten very good income.  She repaid this loan punctually without any difficulties.  She will use the new loan to buy pigs, guinea pigs, feed for the animals, and natural products.  She will do this because it is a good business, and she has customers.

loans.use: to buy pigs, guinea pigs, feed for the animals, and natural products.

loans.name: Faapalagi

texts.en: Faapalagi is a married woman with 9 children. She is requesting this loan to buy new materials to make elei (hand-printed fabric) and printing. Faapalagi joined SPBD in 2009 in order to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new fabric materials, painting boards, threads, needles etc.

loans.name: Morsal Group

texts.en:
This group is called Morsal which consists of 4 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They are helpful members who have known each other for many years.  They have applied for a loan of 110,000 YER .

Safia is 35 years old, and the mother of six children who live together in Taiz. She is the breadwinner who works to earn household expenses for her family. She owns an old house. She intends to remodel her house. She has requested a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to buy construction materials such as wood to use it for her home remodel. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as wood to use for home construction

loans.name: Om-Haba Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om Haba which consists of 4 ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. Each member has a different line of business. 
Najah is 36 years old and a mother of 4 children.  She is responsible for taking care of her family. She works selling perfume, incense and ladies clothing door to door. When she heard about AMB, she immediately applied for a loan of 40,000 YER to buy more inventory to keep her business supplied.

loans.use: to buy perfume, incense and ladies clothing for her business

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Pov is aged 49 years and married. For more than 26 years, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing pineappleto make a living. They can earn about KHR 21,000 per day, and manage to save about KHR 15,000 each day for future needs.

Pov’s group is comprised of two members who live in the same village. Pov is on her third microloan from VisionFund. She fully repaid the past loans, which helped her to better support her family with enough food. As the leader of this group, Pov is going to use her portion of this new loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay costs of harvesting rice. She hopes to get a high yield from her crops, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay costs of harvesting rice.

loans.name: Neav's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Neav is 26 years old and married. She has two children; one is in school while the other is still too young for school. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice for several years; sometimes they also work for others for a fee to earn additional income for the family. 
Neav has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her to relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for labor costs to harvest rice. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs to harvest rice.

loans.name: Siyan

texts.en:
Siyan lives in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 58 years old, married, and has three children. To support her family, she has been working as a rice farmer on a three-hectare plot of farmland for 30 years. From time to time, she raises pigs to earn additional income for the family. The current business earns her about 70,000 KHR per day, and she can afford to save 20,000 KHR each day, after living expenses. 

This is the first microloan for Siyan with VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to buy piglets for raising. She hopes to fatten her pigs, so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Run's Group

texts.en:
Run is 35 years old and married. He lives in a village located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. He has four dependent children, all of whom are still in school. The primary source of his family’s income is cultivating beans. To better support the family, he and his wife also sell vegetables for extra income. Having been in business for 15 years, Run can earn about 51,000 KHR per day, and he manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day, after living expenses.

This is Run's first loan cycle with VisionFund. Now he is leading his group to request a loan of 1,000,000 KHR, each. As the leader, Run is going to use his portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes to get a high yield from his bean crop.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his bean crop.

loans.name: Mas' Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Tbaung Khmum province’s Kampong Cham district, Mas is a 61-year-old mother of five children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She has been involved in planting cassava and is supplementing her family’s income by working for others for a fee. Having been in the business for fifteen years, she can make a daily income from her current business of 30,000KHR and is able to save about 12,000KHR per day after expenses.

Mas’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for two cycles. Mas has completely paid back the past loan which has helped her to better support her family as well as provide for her children’s education. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay labor costs for operating her cassava plantation. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for operating her cassava plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en:
Kea is a 31-year-old mother of two children. She earns a living primarily by farming rice. In addition, she weaves mats while her husband works for others for a fee, to earn extra income to support the family. She has been in this business for five years, and the current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day to feed the family.
 
Kea has been with VisionFund for one previous loan cycle. She completely repaid the past loan. The loan helped her to relieve her family’s burdens and to improve their livelihood.

Now Kea is leading her group to ask for a new loan. She will use her portion of this loan to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a proper house for her family to live in.

loans.use: To renovate her family's old house

loans.name: Mokhtar Group

texts.en:
This group, called Mokhtar, is comprised of seven ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. Nadhira is a 36-year-old, married woman, and has four children. She is a homemaker, who looks forward to seeing her children grow up well.

Nadhira owns a house that needs windows. She doesn't have sufficient money to pay for construction. Therefore, she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy windows for her house. She hopes to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy windows for her house.

loans.name: 162453 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Kathy which consists of 3 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They are hardworking woman. They have applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.

Muna is the leader of this group, a married woman and the mother of six children. Almost all of them are enrolled in school. She owns a small house that  started by her buying a small piece of land. This took great effort on her part. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy construction materials like cement to use for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement to use for her house.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is 35 years old, married, and has four children. She owns a house. She is a responsible woman who works for a better life for her family. She dreams of improving her living standards. 

Amal intends to buy construction materials for her house. She applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to buy windows for her house.

loans.use: to buy windows for her house.

loans.name: Al-Madhina Group

texts.en:
Al-Madhina is a group of three women and a man living in Taiz, Yemen. They were granted a loan of 150,000 by AMB. They aim to improve their businesses by using this loan.

Hasson is 36 years old, married, and the mother of six children between 15 and four years old. She started a small business selling fruits and vegetables three years ago, but she has found it difficult to accumulate a large amount of money to buy various kinds of fruits and vegetables because most of the profits she makes go to clothes and food for her family and to expenses like school fees. 

Therefore, Hasson decided to apply for a loan of 50,000 YER to expand her business and include new kinds of fruits and vegetables to boost profits. Hasson looks forward to opening a small grocery store in the near future instead of selling her goods in the street. This would attract more customers and improve the family's income and help them pass the poverty line.

loans.use: to buy new kinds of fruit and vegetables to boost profits.

loans.name: Al-Manar Group

texts.en:
The Al-Manar group consists of five women from Taiz, Yemen. They have requested a loan of 170,000 YER from AMB.

Seham is a 40-year-old single woman and the leader of the group. She has a technical diploma, and she has taken some training courses in sewing. Now she has the ability and skills needed to start a business as a dressmaker. 

Seham requested a loan of 30,000 YER to help her to buy a sewing machine and other necessary materials. When her profits improve and she becomes a well-known dressmaker, she wants to open a savings account with AMB.

loans.use: to buy sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Forsan Group

texts.en:
The Forsan Group consists of two women and a man who live in Aden, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB. 

Fatima is a 23-year-old married woman who has two children. She is solely responsible for her children, and her only source of income is selling ladies' clothes and mobile phones. She started her business two years ago by requesting a previous loan that allowed her to quickly grow her business. She has applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to stock her business with extra goods like clothes and mobile phones. She hopes this loan will help her improve her living standards

loans.use: to stock her business with extra goods like clothes and mobile phones.

loans.name: Al-Mohaba Group

texts.en:
The Al-Mohaba Group consists of four women members who live in Aden, Yemen. 

Mloka is 32 years old. She has been selling perfumes for many years to help her family financially and improve their quality of life. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 YER to buy some perfumes for her business. This loan is her first, and she hopes to improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy perfume for her business.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; la socia continua con su negocio de venta de desayunos,la socia lleva años en  este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia elabora desayunos como quinua con manzana,quinua con leche,leche,pan con queso,pan con palta entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos como leche,azucar entre otros.
 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Maquimanta Purisun".  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of the same name.

Her name is Luz Marina.  She continues with her business of selling breakfasts.  She has been in this business for years and it is going well thanks to the determination she brings to her business each day.  She makes breakfasts like quinoa with applies, quinoa with milk, milk, bread with cheese, bread with avocado, and others.  She is a responsible and determined person, feeling that in being this way, she can continue moving forward with her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients, like milk and sugar, among other items.

She is happy for this loan and pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like milk, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Khalifa Group

texts.en:
The Khalifa group consists of four women from Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB. They intend to use this loan to buy a flock of sheep for sale.

Arwa, the leader of the group, is 24 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are in school. Since she is uneducated and can't find another job, she decided to apply for a loan of 20,000 YER to buy sheep for sale. This will help her to improve her life conditions and to send her children to school to ensure they have a better future than her own. Arwa wishes to make a profit from selling sheep and accumulate enough money to buy a truck in the future.

loans.use: to buy sheep for sale.

loans.name: Al-Qods Group

texts.en:
Al-qods is a three-member group of women from Taiz, Yemen. They have asked for a 120,000 YER loan from AMB.

Mariam, the leader of the group, is a 37-year-old married woman with four children. She is uneducated, and her husband is the only breadwinner for the family. Most of the money he makes is spent on raising their children and educating them. Their house is very old and needs some basic renovations. The house could fall down at any time. She has started renovating her house, and her funds have been depleted. She needs to complete the renovations, so she asked for a loan of 40,000 YER to buy bricks. She hopes that, after the completion of the renovations, she will feel safe in her house with her husband and children.

loans.use: to buy bricks for construction.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Justina; la socia continua con su negocio de venta de granos secos y venta de anticuchos,la socia lleva buen tiempo con sus negocios los cuales les va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a cada uno de sus negocios,la socia vende los granos secos en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco y la venta de anticuchos lo hace de forma ambulatoria siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para su negocio de venta de anticuchos como aceite, carbon, carne entre otros.

La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Justina belongs to the communal bank "Maquimanta Purisun."  This group meets in the Cusco district, which is located in the province and department of Cusco.

Justina is continuing with her business selling dried grains and anticuchos (kebabs).  She's had her businesses for some time now, and they are doing well thanks to the daily effort she puts into each of them.   Justina sells dried grains in one of the markets in the city of Cusco, and she sells kebabs on the street.  In this way, she is able to provide for her family.  Justina is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her business selling kebabs, such as cooking oil, coal, meat, and other products.

Justina is grateful to be getting this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business selling kebabs, such as cooking oil, coal, meat, and other products

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Guillermo; el socio continua trabajando en el sector educacion,el socio lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su trabajo,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El  socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de viveres para su hogar como arroz,azucar entre otros.

El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The lending club member belongs to the bank "Maquimanta Purisun", located in the district, province and department of Cusco. 

His name is Guillermo and he continues his work in the education sector. He has been doing this for a long time and it's going well thanks to the dedication that he puts into his job every day. He his responsible and dedicated, as this is the way that he gets his family ahead.

He asks for a loan to buy groceries for his home like rice, sugar and other things. He is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with his payments.

loans.use: to buy groceries for his household like rice, sugar and other things.

loans.name: Cinthia Pamela

texts.es:
La joven  Cinthia   de  25  años de edad, vive con su esposo  y  tiene  un hijo que depende de ella, es una persona emprendedora con deseos de superarse y estudia en la universidad por las tardes y los ratos libres los dedica a su negocio que lo realiza de forma ambulante.
Cinthia se dedica desde hace 02  años al negocio de venta de ropa usada, venta de ropa nueva, carteras y lociones, sus clientes son sus amigos y familiares también vende a los empleados de una finca de melón, cercana a su comunidad, su negocio está ubicado en una  comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras,  
Cinthia está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de pantalones, blusas, faldas, camisas, chaquetas, suéteres y achinería, con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y de esta manera mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y salir adelante también en sus estudios, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Cinthia su sueño es tener una casa para ella y su hijo.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del 2012
texts.en:
Cinthia, 25, lives with her husband and she has a dependent child.  She is an enterprising person who has a desire to succeed.  She studies at the university in the afternoons, and in her spare time she has a business selling from door-to-door.  For 2 years now, Cynthia has been selling new and used clothing, purses and lotions.  Her customers are her friends and acquaintances, and she also sells to the employees of a melon farm that is close to her community.  Her business is located in the community of San Lorenzo, in the southern part of Honduras.

Cinthia is requesting a loan to buy pants, blouses, skirts, shirts, jackets, sweaters, and sundries.  With the support of this loan, she plans to increase her income so that she can improve her quality of life a bit, and also make progress with her studies.  She is very content to continue to work with Prisma.

Cinthia's dream is to have her own house for herself and her child.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - December 2012

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, skirts, shirts, jackets, sweaters, and sundries

loans.name: Abadia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Abadia; la socia continua dedicandose a su negocio de carpinteria ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia elabora diferentes tipos de trabajos como mesas,camas,sillas entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de madera para su negocio.

La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Abadia, is a part of the communal bank "MAQUIMANTA PURISUN"; the bank is located in the Cusco District, of the Cusco Province, of the Cusco Region. 

Abadia continues to work in her carpentry business. She has been working for years in this business which is going well for her, thanks to the dedication that puts into it every day. She makes different types of crafts such as tables, beds, and chairs, among other things. She is a responsible and diligent person, and in being that way, she helps move her family forward.

She is requesting this loan to buy lumber for her business.

She is grateful for the loan and she is committed to pay her dues on time.

loans.use: to buy lumber for her business.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia continua con su negocio de venta de jugos,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia elabora diferentes tipos de jugos como naranja, platano con leche ,entre otros,la socia vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco,siendo de esta forma que la socia sale adelante.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de fruta como platanos,naranjas,papayas entre otros.

 La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gregoria continues with her business of selling juices. She has been working for years in this business, which is going well for her thanks to the determination that she puts into it every day. She makes different types of juices such as orange, banana with milk, etc. She sells them in one of the city markets of Cusco, and in this way, she gets ahead. 

She is requesting this loan to buy fruit such as bananas, oranges, and papayas, among others.

She is grateful for the loan and she is committed to fulfill her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as bananas, oranges, and papayas, among others.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de preparacion de tortas,la socia prepara las tortas a pedido para los distintos compromisos que le soliciten como matrimonios,fiesta de 15 años entre otros,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsanble y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su famila.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos como harina,azucar,leche,mantequilla entre otros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Teodora continues to work in the business of making cakes.  She makes cakes by order for different celebrations like weddings and celebrations for 15th birthdays, among others.  She has been in this business for a good amount of time.  It is going well for her thanks to the daily effort she puts into her business.  She is a responsible and diligent person.  That is because this is the way that she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies such as flour, butter, sugar, and milk, among others.  She is happy about the loan, and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, butter, sugar, and milk, among others.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de bazar como peluches,adornos entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia a la vez continua dedicandose a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes ,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan,siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues working selling variety merchandise like stuffed toys and decorations, among others.  She’s been in this business for years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She continues also raising small animals like guinea pigs; she raises these little animals to subsequently sell them to customers that request them and this is the way she supports her family.  She requests the loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
El socio continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de bazar ,el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño quele pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio vende lo que son peluches,adornos entre otros, a la vez el socio sigue dedicandose al negocio de venta de artesania,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de chompas de alpaca para su negocio de artesania.

El socio se siente agradecido  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: He continues working selling merchandise; he’s been in this business for years and does well thanks to the daily effort he puts into it.  He sells stuffed toys and decorations, among others.  At the same time, he continues with the crafts business too.  He’s a responsible, dedicated person who supports his family this way.  He requests the loan to buy alpaca sweaters for his crafts business.  He feels grateful for the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy alpaca sweaters.

loans.name: Esperanza Para El Futuro Group

texts.es: Cordiales Saludos. “Esperanza Para El Futuro” es un grupo conformado por 13 socios responsables y trabajadores que pasan a su 5 ciclo. Favio es un padre perseverante que ha sacado adelante a su familia con su trabajo. Actualmente cuenta con una mototaxi la cual brinda servicio de transporte. También aperturó un puesto donde ofrece hierbas medicinales la cual lo trabaja su esposa. Se siente orgulloso pues gracias a su deseo de progresar a podido brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Su mayor deseo es de comprarse un carro donde pueda brindarlo como servicio de transporte. Solicito el crédito para el mantenimiento de su moto y la compra de productos naturales. Favio tiene 32 años, casado con 02 hijos menores de edad.  El grupo “Esperanza Para El Futuro” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito.  Favio se encuentra sentado es el segundo del lado izquierdo y viste camisa celeste con rayas blancas.
texts.en:
Cordial Greetings.

“Esperanza Para El Futuro” (Hope for the Future) is a group of 13 responsible, hardworking members who are going through their fifth cycle.  Favio is a persevering father who has raised his family by means of his work.  He currently has a mototaxi he uses to provide transportation services.  He also relates that he opened a stand to sell medicinal herbs that is wife manages.  He feels proud because by his desire to progress he’s been able to provide better quality of life for his family. 

His greatest wish is to buy a car to use to provide transportation services.  He requested a loan to service his motorcycle and to buy natural products.  Favio is 32-years-old, married and has two minor children.

The “Esperanza Para El Futuro” group thanks those who made this loan possible.  Favio is seated; he’s second from the left and is wearing a sky blue shirt with white stripes.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and to buy natural remedies.

loans.name: G.s Fuente De Vida Group

texts.es:
La Señora Ena, tiene 45 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella, vive con su esposo, su actividad es el comercio y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan y rosquillas.
Doña Ena cuenta con más de 14 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad generadora de ingresos, tiene una buena clientela y su negocio lo realiza de manera domiciliar y ambulante, su producto lo vende en los principales negocios de su comunidad, ésta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de queso, leña, maíz, azúcar, huevos, soda y harina que son la materia prima para la elaboración de su producto.
Doña Ena espera poder surtir bien su negocio y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, y con las ganancias que obtenga espera mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Doña Ena su sueño es tener una casa propia y darle los estudio a sus hijos.
Doña Eva se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de tortillas y renta de cuartos de habitación.
Ogla se dedica a la venta de granos básicos.
Doña Idalia se dedica a la venta de medicina popular y tambien vende ropa americana.     



Danlí, Honduras - Diciembre 2012
texts.en:
Ena, 45, has two dependent children.  She lives with her husband and her activity is commerce.  She works baking and selling bread and ‘rosquillas’ [traditional cookies].  Ena has more than 14 years’ experience in this income-generating activity.  She has a good clientele and she carries out her activities both at home and from place to place.  She sells her products to all the main businesses in her community.  She’s requesting the loan to buy cheese, firewood, corn, sugar, eggs, baking soda and flour which are the raw materials to make her product.  Ena hopes to stock her business well to meet customer demand and to use profits earned to improve her and her family’s quality of life a little.  Ena’s dream is to own a house and provide schooling for her children.  

Eva works making and selling tortillas and renting rooms and Olga works selling basic grains.  Idalia López works selling popular medicines and American clothes.

Danlí, Honduras - December,  2012

loans.use: to buy cheese, firewood, corn, sugar, eggs, baking soda and flour.

loans.name: Patricia Maribel

texts.es:
La socia Patricia Maribel,continua dedicandose al negocio de turismo,la socia es guia de turismo de profesion, la socia lleva años ejerciendo su carrera el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su trabajo,la socia guia diferentes lugares como tours a Machupicchu,City Tours,Valle Sagrado entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia. 

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de boletos turisticos.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Patricia Maribel continues to run a tourism business.  She is a guide and has been doing this for years.  Things are going well for her because of the daily effort she puts in.  She provides tours to Machupicchu, City Tours, Valle Sagrado and other places.  She is a responsible, enterprising woman who gets her family ahead in this manner.

She is asking for this loan to buy tourist tickets.

She is grateful for this loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tourist tickets.

loans.name: Manuel Concepcion

texts.es:
El socio continua dedicandose al negocio de restaurante, el socio lleva años en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,a la vez el socio tambien vende chicha de jora y frutillada en su restaurante,el socio es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de insumos como carne,aceite,arroz entre otros.

El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member has had a restaurant for several years and things have been going well, thanks to the daily effort he puts in.  He prepares breakfasts, lunches, and dinner.  He also sells chicha and fruit drinks in his restaurant.  He is a responsible person who gets his family ahead in this way.

He is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as meat, cooking oil, rice, and other things.

He is grateful for the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy incredients.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TINKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio continua con su negocio de brosteria,el socio lleva años en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio a la vez continua trabajando en el area administrativa en una de las universidades de la ciudad del Cusco,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

 El  socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos como pollo,aceite,gaseosas entre otros.
 El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
He is a member of the “TINKA” communal bank, located in the Cusco district, province, and department.

He still has his brosterie business and has had it for several years.  Things are going well for him, thanks to the daily effort he puts in.  While he runs his business he also works as a manager at a university in Cusco.  He is a responsible, dedicated man and gets his family ahead in this way.

He is asking for this loan to buy supplies such as chicken, cooking oil, soft drinks, and other things.

He is grateful for the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Rina Elena

texts.es:
La socia Rina Elena continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de artesania,la socia elabora chompas,carteras chuyos entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual leva bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende su mercaderia en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad de Cusco,la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de lanas,cierres,botones entre otros para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rina Elena continues to sell arts and crafts.  She makes sweaters, wallets, chuyos, and other things.  She has been doing this for years and things have gone well thanks to the dedication she puts in each day.  She sells her merchandise at different fairs in Cusco, is a responsible person, and gets her family ahead in this manner.

She will use the money from this loan to buy yarn, zippers, buttons, and other things for her business.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La  socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de adornos de navidad,manteles,peluches entre otros,la socia lleva buen tiempo con este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia a la vez continua trabajando en una empresa privada siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su famila.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de materiales como hilos,telas,lanas de diferentes colores entre otros.

La socia se siente agradecida  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues her Christmas decoration, table cloth, and stuffed animal business.  She has been doing this for a long time and things have gone well, thanks to the dedication she puts in each day.  She also continues to work for a private company and gets her family ahead in this manner.

She is asking for this loan to buy thread, fabric, and yarn of different colors.

She is grateful for this loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Juan Roberto

texts.es:
El socio continua dedicandose a estudiar la carrera prefesional de psicologia ,el socio estudia en una de las universidades de la ciudad  de Cusco ,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso ,el socio desea poder continuar estudiando para de esta forma ser profesional y trabajar en una buena empresa.
El socio solicita el credito para pagar sus estudios universitarios.


El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues to study psychology a one of the universities in Cusco.  He is responsible and dedicated and wants to continue studying so that he can become a professional and work for a good company.  He is asking for a loan to pay his university tuition.

He is grateful and commits to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: G.s Dios Con Nosotros Group

texts.es:
La señora Olga se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de abarroteria desde hace 10 años, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y su negocio es su fuente principal de ingresos, vive en una comunidad de Danli, al oriente de Honduras.
Doña Olga tiene ubicado su negocio en la calle principal de su comunidad siendo este la única pulpería y atiende una gran cantidad de personas, el préstamo que reciba lo ocupa para mejorar su negocio y a su vez mejorar sus ingresos y cambiar un poco su condición de vida.
Doña Olga solicita el préstamo para la compra de producto como ser: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, manteca, embutidos, leches, quesos, mantequilla, margarina, carnes de pollo, res, cerdos, etc. sueña con que su negocio se mas grande y poder salir adelante con su familia dandole una buena educación a su hijo.
Doña María su fuente principal de ingresos proviene de su negocio venta ropa, cosméticos, zapatos productos por catalogo, pescado y jaiba, desde hace 26 años.


Danlí, Honduras - Diciembre 2012
texts.en:
Olga has been selling groceries for ten years.  She is a very hard worker and her business represents her main source of income.  She lives in a community in Danli, in eastern Honduras.

Olga's store is located on the community's main street and is the only grocery business in the community.  She attends to many customers and plans to use the loan to improve her business so she can increase her income and live a better lifestyle.

Olga will use the loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, beans, lard, sausages, milk, cheese, butter, margarine, chicken, beef, pork, etc.  Her goal is to expand her business and prosper together with her family, while providing a good education for her son.

María's business for the last 26 years has been selling clothing, cosmetics, shoes, catalogue products, fish and crab.

Danlí, Honduras - December 2012

loans.use: To buy groceries for Olga's store.

loans.name: Lorena Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Lorena trabaja en cobranza para una oficina en donde tiene 3 años laborando, sus 2 hijos  estudian uno ya va a la universidad y el otro cursa la secundaria, así Lorena se desempeña para poder cubrir con todos los gastos del hogar, su negocio es la renta de apartamentos y con este nuevo crédito piensa hacer mejoras en ellos para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes por lo que necesita comprar bloques, cemento, hierro, arena, para hacer las paredes de concreto ya que son de madera, cerámica, materiales para cielo raso, laminas de zinc para cambiar el techo, todo esto le es posible gracias al apoyo que recibe de su esposo quien trabaja por cuenta propia en obras de construcción, con ese apoyo ella logra pagar sus financiamientos por los que está muy agradecida con la financiera y Kiva.
texts.en: Doña Lorena has been working in the collection department of an office for 3 years. She has two children, one of them studying at university and the other attending secondary school, so she works to cover all her household expenses. She also has her own business of apartment rentals and plans to use this new loan to make improvements in the apartments and provide a better service to her clients. She needs to buy blocks, cement, iron and sand to make the concrete walls (now made of wood), and ceramic, ceiling materials and zinc layers to change the ceilings. All of this is possible thanks to the support of her husband, who is self-employed and works in construction. This support allows her to repay her loans, for which she's very grateful to the financial institution and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, iron, sand, ceramic, ceiling materials and zinc layers.

loans.name: Keiry

texts.es:
La joven Keiry  de  26 años de edad es soltera y tiene  un  hijo que depende de ella, no tiene casa propia y vive con sus padres, se dedica desde hace 02  años al negocio de venta de ropa de todas las marcas, zapatos, cosméticos y perfumes achinería en general, ventiladores adornos y mucho mas.
Keiry sus clientes son los amigos y personas que a diario le visitan en su negocio, también son sus clientes los maestros que le llegan a comprar sus productos, personas que trabajan en los bancos, gente de la portuaria, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Keiry  está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de camisas, pantalones, vestidos, faldas, blusas, zapatos, sandalias y accesorios para damas, con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar un poco sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Keiry su deseo es crecer en su negocio y tener su propia casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del 2012
texts.en:
Keiry, 26, is single and has a young son.  She does not own her own house and lives with her parents.  For two years she has been in the business of selling all brands of clothing, shoes, cosmetics, perfumes, fans, ornaments and much more.  Her customers are friends and people who visit her daily, as well as teachers, bank employees, and port workers who all live in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.

Keiry is requesting a loan to buy shirts, pants, dresses, skirts, blouses, shoes, sandals and women's accessories in an effort to improve her income and quality of life.  She is very happy to continue working with Prisma.  Her goal is to expand her business and buy her own house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - December 2012

loans.use: To buy shirts, pants, dresses, skirts, blouses, shoes, sandals and women's accessories for her business.

loans.name: Lesly

texts.es:
