texts.en: Amabiel is 28 year old young man from a farming family that is engaged in coffee growing.  He has continued the tradition and currently has a sown field.  Six years ago, he bought a place where he opened a discothèque with the goal of providing a service that didn’t exist in his community.  Now, he alternates the two activities and has one employee to help him.  He works daily from 5:30 in the morning to 6:00 in the evening, Monday through Friday.  On the weekends, he takes care of the discothèque.  His greatest dream is to become a successful businessman and coffee grower.  He is requesting the loan to purchase farming inputs and liqueur for his business.  He hopes to make his life project a reality and be able to provide his parents with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase farming inputs and liqueur for his business.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.es: La Sra. Encarnación tiene 48 años,  se dedica  a la confección de guantes para cocina desde hace ya varios años que ella confecciona estos guantes en su taller que se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio que es en la zona de Pampahasi,  Este préstamo es su  Primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Encarnación va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra una maquina recta a medio uso y de telas para la confección sus guantes  por mayor, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión. La Sra. Encarnación enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de guantes, ella ofrece sus productos en distintas ferias ya hace a pedido ya que estos guantes son muy útiles para sacar las bandejas del horno como también para levantar ollas muy calientes  La Sra. Encarnación es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Encarnación, 48, has been sewing oven gloves for a living for several years. She sews the gloves in her workshop, which is located in her home, in the Pampahasi area. 

This loan is her first cycle with the institution. Encarnación will use the loan to buy a sewing machine and fabrics to make into gloves for the wholesale market. 

Her motivation for requesting the loan is to increase her investment capital. Encarnación faces challenges in her business, which are to increase her income and use her profits to invest them in materials for sewing gloves. She sells her products at market and makes them to order. Her gloves are very useful for taking hot trays out of the oven and lifting very hot pots.

Encarnación is a very hard-working person and feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support is has offered.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Tierra Fértil  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Tierra Fértil está formado por 7 socias que en su maytoría son familiares, trabajan diariamente en diferentes actividades laborales, las misma que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias, son personas amables, gentiles y de un gran carisma que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por el sector de Cochapamba que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, parroquia que ha tenido un gran crecimiento comercial, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Mónica, es socia del banco comunal Tierra Fértil desde hace 2 años, le gusta estar en el banco comunal porque en cada reunión afianza los lasos de amistada con todas sus compañeras del grupo.
 
La Señora. Mónica tiene 36 años de edad, está divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 20 y 19 años, su primera hija estudia en una universidad de la ciudad y su segundo hijo tiene una discapacidad por lo que pasa en casa. La casa en la que vive es de su propia.

Doña Mónica pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa al cuidado de su hogar, en su casa tiene una tienda de comestibles desde hace 5 años en la cual trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo y también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos hace 7 años. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su negocio. 

Su meta es agrandar más su tienda.
texts.en:
The communal bank Tierra Fértil [Fertile Ground] is made up of seven members, most of whom are related to each other.  They all work daily at different work activities that allow them to contribute to their household incomes and provide for their families.  They are kind, friendly and charismatic, and they continue to maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

They live in the sector of Cochapamba, which belongs to the Valle parish of Cuenca.  This parish has seen a large amount of commercial growth, and its architecture is a mix of the traditional and the modern.

Monica is one of the members of this communal bank, and she has been a member for two years.  She says she likes being a member of the communal bank because each meeting reinforces the bonds of friendship among all of its members.

Monica is 36 years old, divorced and has a daughter, age 20, and a son, age 19.  Her daughter studies in the city university.  Her son has a disability, for which he stays at home.

Monica owns her own home, in which for five years now she has had a small grocery store.  She spends her time looking after her home and working her grocery business, which she operates daily without a fixed schedule.  She has also worked for seven years now at selling cosmetics.

With this loan Monica will buy supplies to stock her grocery store.  Her goal is to increase the size of her store.

loans.use: to buy supplies to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La Sra. Virginia tiene 33 años, tiene  dos hijos que son de las edades de  7 y de 10 años, sus niños se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de salchipapas,  hamburguesas simple y con papas en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Villa Fátima,  este préstamo es el primero que tiene con la institución, la Sra. Virginia va a usar este préstamo para compra de insumos como salchicha y papa y demás productos que  utiliza para la elaboración de sus comidas, la Sra. Virginia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el horario que tiene de venta ya que sale por las noches,  la señora puede ser víctima de delincuentes, borrachos y demás personas que merodean por la noche,  además del frio por la temporada de lluvia puede contraer enfermedades respiratorias, además de enfermedades musculares pero ella trabaja duro por el bienestar de sus hijos, ella  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de insumos para seguir mejorando en su negocio y  poder expandirse más y así poder ahorrar, y salir adelante. Su deseo de la Sra. Virginia es poder abrir su pensión de comida o snack propio y sacar adelante a sus dos hijos pequeños.
texts.en: Virginia is 33 and has two sons aged 7 and 10, who go to school. She sells a dish made with sausage and chips, as well as hamburgers with or without chips. Her fast-food stand is located in the area of Villa Fátima. This is Virginia's first loan with the field partner. She will use it to buy the ingredients she needs, such as sausage, potatoes, and others. She faces many difficulties in her business, one being that she works nights, and as such could fall prey to some delinquent, or be assaulted by a drunkard or any other shady character that roams the night. In the rainy season, the cold puts her at risk of contracting a respiratory disease, and all the hard work she does could result in pulling a muscle or developing back troubles. She works very hard for the sake of her sons, and is planning to use the profits from her food stall to keep improving her business and to expand it. She hopes to save some money and improve her lot in life. Her greatest dream is to open a small restaurant or food shop of her own and to be able to give her two small children a better life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make the food she sells.

loans.name: Concepcion Catalina

texts.es: La Sra. Concepción sigue con la misma actividad de la fabricación y venta de calzados de mujer, ella trabaja junto a su esposo  nos conto  que le fue muy bien con el crédito, ahora incremento su producción, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de cuero y materiales para la fabricación de calzados ya que en este último tiempo incremento su clientela.
texts.en: Concepción keeps at her business of making and selling women's shoes. She works together with her husband, and tells us that the last loan helped them tremendously. She is now stepping up her production, as she gained more customers, and is thus asking for a loan in order to buy leather and other supplies to make shoes.

loans.use: to buy leather to make shoes.

loans.name: Lilliam Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Lilliam, una señora humilde que ha cursado hasta el bachillerato, ahora es madre soltera, se ha separado de su esposo y ella es quien vela por sus hijos, ha pasado por tiempos malos cuando se le accidento su hijo menor a quien tuvieron que operar, se vio sola para salir adelante gracias a Dios eso ya paso ahora continua de frente solicitando crédito para invertir en su negocio que ahora es una venta donde ofrece granos básicos, carnes, tortillas, útiles escolares, sazonadores, gaseosas entre otros, todos estos productos son los que necesita comprar para mantener siempre activo el negocio y continuar apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en: Lilliam, a humble lady who completed secondary school, is now a single mother. She is separated and raises her children on her own. She went through a rough patch when her youngest child suffered an accident which warranted a surgical procedure. Though she felt very much alone at that moment, she thanks God that they managed to overcome it. She is full of fighting spirit and asks now for a loan to invest in her shop, where she sells basic grains, meat, tortillas, school supplies, spices, and fizzy drinks, among others. She needs to continuously renew her supply of these products in order to keep her shop going and to support her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies to sell.

loans.name: Margiana

texts.es: La Sra. Margiana tiene 33 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida tiene una pequeña pensión que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Tembladerani,  este préstamo es el primero que tiene con la institución, la Sra. Margiana va a usar este préstamo para compra de un horno industrial e insumos como papa,   abarrotes y demás productos que  utiliza para la elaboración de sus comidas, la Sra. Margiana  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mesa y sillas ya que quiere ampliar su local para seguir mejorando en su negocio y  poder expandirse ya que tiene mucha clientela y ella desea brindar comodidad y variedad de platillos a su familia.
texts.en: Margiana is 33 years old. She sells food and owns a small restaurant located in the area of Tembladerani. This would be her first loan with the field partner. Margiana will use the funds to buy an industrial oven as well as supplies such as potatoes, groceries, and other products she uses as ingredients for preparing the meals. Her idea is to use the profits to buy chairs and tables, as she wants to enlarge her locale in order to keep improving and expanding her business, for she has many customers. She wants her family to have a comfortable life and eat varied meals.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven as well as supplies.

loans.name: Los Laureles  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Los Laureles es un banco comunal que está formado por 6 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar que se encuentra rodeado de mucha vegetación, tiene hermoso paisajes formados por su accidentada geografía, su centro es una mezcla de la arquitectura antigua con la moderna. Su gente  son personas amables y de un corazón muy cálido que buscan en el día a día mejorar su situación económica gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo, laboran en la crianza de animales, agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Norma, es una socia amable, gentil, luchadora y trabajadora que conforma el banco comunal Los Laureles desde hace 3 años.

La señora Norma tiene 28 años de edad, está separada de su marido pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 11 y 2 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es propia.
 
Doña Norma trabaja en la limpieza de una casa, actividad que la desempeña desde muy joven y trabaja de lunes a viernes todo el día. En su casa se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos, pollos y cuyes. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos, pollos, cuyes y alimento para animales.

Su meta es agrandar su casa.
texts.en:
Los Laureles is a communal bank comprised of seven members (six women and a man), who all live in the village of Cumbe, in Cuenca, a place enshrined in vegetation, blessed with beautiful landscapes born of its mountainous surroundings, and whose centre is a happy mix of old and new architecture. The people there are charming and have a warm heart. They seek day after day to improve their standard of living by working hard and sparing no efforts. They grow crops or raise various kinds of animals, and, for the most part, also work in the city in various business sectors. They still uphold the culture and traditions of their forefathers.

Norma is one of the members of the group. Amiable, kind-hearted, hard-working, and full of fighting spirit, she has been a part of Los Laureles for three years.

She is twenty-eight and separated from her husband, with whom she has two children, aged 2 and 11. Her first daughter goes to a small school in their town. Norma lives in a house of her own.
 
Norma works as a cleaning lady Monday to Friday. She started when she was very young. At home, she raises pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs to sell.

Her new loan will go towards buying animals as well as feed.

Her goal is to add rooms to her house.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, guinea pigs, and animal feed.

loans.name: Net's Group

texts.en:
Net lives in a rural area, located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. Net is a 59-year-old, married mother of seven children. To make a living, she has been farming rice and planting cassava for 33 years. The current business earns her about 8,000KHR per day, and she manages to save about 4,000KHR each day, after daily living expenses. 

Net has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles, and she completely paid back the past loans. Those loans have helped her to better support her family with enough food. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a new loan. As the leader, Net is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her crops. She hopes to grow her rice timely and fruitfully, so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Phoern's Group

texts.en:
Born and raised in a rural village, located in the Kror Kor district of Pusat province, Phoern is 34 years old and married. She has two children, both of whom are dependent on her and in school. She and her husband have earned their living by farming rice and producing Khmer noodles, for 20 years. The current business earns her about 20,000KHR per day to meet the family's needs.

Phoern has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle, while the other group member has been with VisionFund for five cycles. Phoern completely paid back the past loan. That loan helped her to better support her family, with enough household supplies. Now she is leading her group of two to request another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice timely and healthfully, so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Lang's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Kror Kor district of Pursat province in Cambodia, Lang is 52 years old and widowed. She has four children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. Lang is a rice farmer on two hectares of farmland. She has been in this business for three years. She can earn about 70,000KHR per day from her current business, and she manages to save about 20,000KHR after her daily living expenses. 

Lang has been with VisionFund for just one loan cycle. Now she is leading her group of three to request a new loan of 600,000KHR, each person. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to realize more income from her current business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
Ren is a 48-year-old, married woman, who resides in a rural village of Pursat's Sampov Meas district, in Cambodia. She has seven children, three of whom remain under her responsibility and still in school. To support the family, Ren farms rice, earning around 24,000 KHR daily. 

Ren has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles, and she completely paid back the past loans. Those loans helped her to better support her family. Now, she is leading her group of three to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to pay for labor for harvesting rice, and to buy piglets for raising to earn extra income for the family. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To pay for labor for harvesting rice, and to buy piglets for raising.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom is a resident of Moung Russey district in Cambodia's Battambang province. She is 31 years old and married with two children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, Sokhom farms rice and sells rice soup. Her husband also complements the income by working as a house construction worker in local area. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day, after daily expenses.

Sokhom has been with VisionFund for three cycles while the other member of the group has just joined VisionFund this cycle. Sokhom is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to get a high yield from her paddy field business so as to make a better living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Bolormaa is 49 years old and the mother of three children. She still lives in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Also, her spouse still works in Korea by governmental labor contract. Her previous loan was used to start her business.

Mongolia has 4 seasons and they are very unpredictable. In winter especially, the weather is very cold: it hits -40C. Now her grocery store's heating system is frozen and she wants to renovate it. So she is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to renovate her store's heating system.

loans.use: to reovate her grocery store's heating system.

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Nget is a 59-year-old married woman living in a rural area of Moung Russey district in Cambodia’s Battambang province. She is blessed with six children, one (a son) of whom is still dependent on her. Nget and her husband offer a decent life for the family by working as rice farmers. To add more income to the family, Nget also has a business selling dessert. They are able to earn around 6,000KHR per day and save only approximately 3,000KHR after canceling out the daily expenses. Nget has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for five loan cycles already, with which she succeeded in improving the family’s livelihood. She is now seeking a KHR 4,000,000 loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay wages to farm laborers to harvest rice. Nget hopes to harvest a good-quality crop so that she can sell it for a good price, generating more income for the family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay wages to farm laborers

loans.name: Kuy's Group

texts.en:
Kuy is 27 years old and lives in the rural village of Moung Russey in Cambodia’s Battambang province. She is married and the mother of two dependent children, both of whom are too young to go to school. To support her family, she and her husband have worked as rice farmers for the last seven years, earning around 14,000 KHR daily and saving approximately 8,000 KHR after paying expenses. Kuy has taken out and repaid five previous loans from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and successfully used the loan to make her family’s lifestyle better. She is now requesting a new loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to ensure a good harvest. 

Kuy leads a two-person loan group whose members want to borrow 2,600,000 KHR. She plans to use the additional income she earns to send her children to a good school in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Keoun

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of Moung Russey district in Cambodia’s Battambang province, Keoun is 53 years of age and married. She has 11 children, six of whom are dependent on her. Three of Keoun’s children are currently in school. 

To continually provide income to the family, Keoun and her husband have been working as rice farmers for 20 years, earning around 50,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. This will be Keoun’s fourth time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans have enabled Keoun to secure her rice-growing business. 

Keoun is now in need of money to strengthen her business by purchasing fertilizer and paying wages to farm laborers to harvest rice. Keoun hopes to harvest a good-quality crop so that she can sell the rice at a good price, generating more income for the family. She will also utilize her anticipated income to improve her family’s lifestyle and further advance her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and to pay wages to farm laborers.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Mrs.Tsetsegmaa is a 33-year-old married woman who has three children. All three of her children attend high school, while her spouse is a truck driver. She lives in an outer ger district that lacks the basic infrastructure of the city. 

Since August of 2012, she has owned small shoe stall at the largest outdoor market. Now she wants to increase her working capital, therefore she needs more shoes, boots and sandals. This loan will be used to purchase shoes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell in order to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Soum's Group

texts.en:
Soum, 48, is a citizen living in Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district. She is married and blessed with four children, one (a daughter) of whom is still under her responsibility and is currently in school. To make a living, Soum works as a rice farmer and a paid worker. Her husband works as a construction worker to complement their income. Together, this hardworking couple can earn approximately 40,000KHR per day and save around 13,000KHR after canceling out daily expenses. 

Soum has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two loans cycles already, with which she succeeded in making her family’s livelihood better. She is now leading a loan group of two female members to take out a new loan with VisionFund in the amount of 1,200,000KHR each. As the group's representative, Soum will utilize her loan portion to purchase fertilizer and to cover the costs of labor. Soum hopes to attain better living conditions after receiving the loan portion and wisely using it.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and cover the costs of labor

loans.name: Kimlean

texts.en:
Kimlean, 34 years old, is a citizen residing in a rural area of Dambae district, in Cambodia’s Kampong Cham province. She is married and a mother of four children, all of whom are dependent on her. To make a living, Kimlean plants cassava, while her husband works for others as a paid laborer to add more income to the family. Kimlean and her husband are able to generate income for their family of around 20,000KHR daily.

Kimlean has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two loan cycles already. With her previous loans she succeeded in purchasing pesticide and paying the cost of labor. Kimlean is now seeking a new loan with VisionFund in the amount of 2,000,000KHR, to pay for plowing land and to pay wages to farm laborers. This hard-working mother (Kimlean) hopes to send her children to good schools in the future, and to be able to guarantee food security for her beloved family.

loans.use: to pay for plowing land and to pay wages to farm laborers.

loans.name: Pheang

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Dambae district, in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, Pheang is a 63-year-old widow. She is a mother of three children. This single mother offers a decent life for the family by planting cassava and growing rice. Having been in her current business for more than 30 years, Pheang earns approximately 35,000KHR per day and saves around 23,000KHR, after paying the daily living expenses.

This is Pheang’s second time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan enabled her to cover daily expenses and improve her family’s living standard. Pheang is now requesting a KHR 2,000,000 loan, to strengthen her current business by buying rice seed, cassava seed, fertilizer and pesticide, and paying the rent on the farmland she works. This industrious mother (Pheang) wants to earn as much income as possible from the business that she has been doing, generating more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, cassava seed, fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay the rent on the farmland she works.

loans.name: Seng Ann's Group

texts.en:
Fifty-one-year-old Seng Ann is a villager living in Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district in Cambodia. She is a widow and a mother of two children. This hard-working single mother works many jobs in order to provide a decent life for her family: She farms rice, works for others as a paid worker, and sells grocery items. Each day, she is able to earn around 18,000 KHR and save approximately 6,000 KHR for future needs after canceling out the daily cost of living. 

Seng Ann has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for a loan cycle already, with which she accomplished securing her family’s finances. She is now leading a female group member, who also has been with VisionFund for a loan cycle, to seek a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. Seng Ann will use her loan portion to pay wages to farm laborers to harvest rice and to purchase more grocery items to sell. Seng Ann's biggest hope is to be able to sufficiently support her family.

loans.use: To pay wages to farm laborers and to purchase more grocery items to sell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Soneth's Group

texts.en:
Soneth is a villager who lives in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district in Cambodia. She is twenty years of age and married with two dependent sons. To make a living, Soneth raises pigs and plants cassava. Her husband also works for others as a paid worker to add more income to the family. Together, this hard-working couple is able to earn approximately 18,000 KHR daily and, after offsetting for daily expenses, save approximately 3,000 KHR for future needs.

This will be Soneth’s fourth time requesting a loan via Kiva Field Partner, VisionFund. The previous loans have helped her to purchase piglets to run her pig-raising business, which enables her to generate extra income for the family. Soneth is now in need of money to purchase more piglets to raise in order to expand her business, generating even more income. Thus, she is leading a group of three female members to take out a loan in the amount of 3,400,000 KHR in total.

Soneth’s hope is to earn as much income as possible to continually provide a decent life for her family and to send her beloved children to a good school in the future.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Nhet's Group

texts.en:
A villager named Nhet resides in a rural village of the Dambae district, in Cambodia’s Kampong Cham province. She is a 32-year-old, married woman and a mother of five dependent kids. Some of Nhet‘s children are students.

To support the family, Nhet has a business planting cassava, earning around 25,000KHR per day and saving around 10,000KHR, after offsetting the daily living expenses. Nhet, a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner), is leading a group of three female members to take out a loan in the amount of 3,400,000KHR in total. Nhet stated that with her two previous loans she was able to better run her cassava-planting business. This time, she will use her loan portion to cover the cost of labor for plowing her cassava field. Nhet hopes to earn as much income as possible from her current business, so that she can send all of her dependent kids to good schools and improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To cover the cost of labor, for plowing the field where she cultivates cassava.

loans.name: Batdelger

texts.en:
Mr.Batdelger is a 32-year-old, married man, who lives with his two daughters, wife and son, in an outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His neighborhood lacks basic infrastructure. Batdelger's son attends college, while his younger sisters attend a local kindergarten. 

Borrower Batdelger is operating a business with his wife, making traditional Mongolian small caps that have a button on top. He said: "Now it's the beginning of the great traditional holiday of Mongolia. Thus, my business became very popular. During this holiday period people wear national clothes, so they buy caps, deels (traditional Mongolian dress) and other traditional Mongolian wear. 

He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase more materials for making traditional caps, such as silk and cotton.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for making traditional Mongolian caps, in time for a surge of demand expected to come from a national holiday of Mongolia.

loans.name: Soum

texts.en:
A 39-year-old married villager named Soum lives in a rural area of the Kror Kor district in Cambodia's Pursat province. She is blessed with six children, five of whom are currently students, while the other one is too young for schooling. Her family's income mainly comes from their rice-growing business, in which Soum has been involved for six years. To add more income to the family, Soum also works as a teacher, while her husband works as a paid worker. 

Together, they earn approximately 20,000KHR per day. Soum has been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) one loan cycle already, with which she accomplished making her family's lifestyle so much better. Now she is seeking a KHR 1,500,000 loan to run a new business, a pig-raising business, by purchasing piglets to raise. Soum hopes to improve her living standard even more, as well as her family's. She will also use her anticipated income to give her children a higher education and, hopefully, be able to send her young kid to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Rubeena

texts.en:
Ms Rubeena is a 33-year-old married woman. She has four children, two daughters and two sons. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health. The man shown in the photo is Rubeena’s husband, who is a tailor by profession but his income is not sufficient to meet with the daily expenditures of the family members. Therefore, two years ago, Rubeena decided to join her husband’s business to contribute to the family income. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques. 

Rubeena took her first loan to buy a sewing machine from Kashf Foundation. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. Now she has requested for a loan of Rs 20,000 to purchase spools of thread with the packs of buttons, ribbons and zippers in various colors. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread with the packs of buttons, ribbons and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Zaib

texts.en:
Ms Zaib is 42 years old. She has been running a tailoring business for the past twenty years. She is expert in stitching stylish dresses for women. She stitches for the people living around her house, and she uses the income to support her entire family. She has four children. They are all studying in high classes. Her husband's income is insufficient to provide all the necessities to their family.

Zaib counts a good client list. However, due to a lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is currently in her second loan cycle and has borrowed PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials for dressmaking, including cloth, thread of different colors, lace and zippers. The materials will create a means of increasing revenues, to enable her to generate a healthier income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making dresses, including cloth, thread in different colors, lace and zippers

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Ms Kalsoom is a 36-year-old lady. She is a very hard-working and committed woman. She is in her fourth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. For the past ten years, Kalsoom has been running a business, producing and selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family. Prior to her action, her husband had been the only bread earner for the family. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. 

Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000. She will use this money to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Ms Bushra is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been running a milk selling business for the past 15 years. She has three buffalo in milk and sells their milk to half the people in her community, along with butter, cheese and ghee that she makes from the milk. She has a good client list. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life.
 
She is a mother to seven children. She is liable to provide them with good quality food, heath and education. In order to increase her sales, she wants to purchase one more buffalo. To achieve this, she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 25000 to increase milk production. In this way she would be able to serve more people in her community.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a 29-year-old married lady. She is very talented and excels in the work of making footballs. She has been running this business for two years and over this time she has become well known for providing good quality footballs. She sells them in the local market and to the people of her community. She has also hired some people to stitch footballs so she can meet the orders on time. 

She has five children. Her husband is working as a laborer but his income is not enough to cover family expenditures. In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers she needs to purchase rubber bladders and spools of thread in large quantities. For this purpose she has applied for a loan of 25000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation. She dreams of providing her children with a good quality education through all her hard work in the business.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders and spools of thread in large quantities.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 43-year-old married woman. She has four children, two daughters and two sons. She is striving hard to meet their needs, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. She started her sewing business to contribute to the family's income. She is very familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation; currently she is requesting a loan of 15,000 PKR to buy a new sewing machine, spools of thread and colored buttons. With this investment in her business, she would be able to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to increase her earnings and wishes to provide her children with a quality education.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, spools of thread and colored buttons.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Ms Zahida is a 39-year-old married woman. She is a mother of seven children - three daughters and four sons - in which three of them are earning. But the increasing expenses are far more than the earnings. Therefore, she is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed at a small restaurant. 

She has had a business of stitching for many years. She receives orders for special occasions like weddings. She is well familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of the Kashf foundation; she took her first loan, which amounted Rs 20,000, to purchase a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity within her community. Currently she requests a loan of Rs 20,000 again to buy spools of threads with packs of lace, ribbons, and zippers in various colors. Then, she will be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving good quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread with packs of lace, ribbons, and zippers in various colors

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 35-year-old married woman. She has four children, two daughters and two sons. She is striving hard to meet their needs, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. She started her business to contribute to the family income. She has been in the business of sewing for many years. She is very familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation; she took out her first loan to buy a stitching machine. Now she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

She requested a loan of Rs 15,000 to buy spools of threads with packs of buttons, laces and zippers in various colors to be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads with packs of buttons, laces and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Fahra

texts.en:
Ms. Fahra is a 27-year-old lady. Two years ago, she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. Farha has three sisters and two brothers. 

By now she has maintained a regular list of customers. However, due to a lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. That is why she contacted Kashf Foundation for the second time and applied for a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials including cloths, threads of different colors, laces and zippers, etc., to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She wishes to spend part of the income on providing a quality education to her siblings.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including cloths, threads of different colors, laces and zippers, etc.

loans.name: Amanat

texts.en:
Ms Amanat is a 40-year-old, married woman, and a mother of five children. She has been running a business of milk sales for the past 20 years.  She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo, to help support her family. Until that purchase, her husband had been the only bread earner for their family. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters.

While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies, and sending her other children to the best school of the area. She is in her seventh loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. She has some savings, and she has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to enable her to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo for dairy use.

loans.name: Jeevan

texts.en:
Jeevan is 37 years old and the mother of six children. For the past 20 years, she has been running a milk sales business. She is running this business with the help of her husband and sons; they assist her by supplying the milk door-to-door and in the local market. She has five buffaloes and one milk cow.  Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as in financial matters.

While talking to the Kashf officer, Jeevan shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her children to school for better education. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. Jeevan is in her second loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Rozeena

texts.en:
Ms Rozeena is a 45-year-old, married woman, who has been running a small general store for the past two years. She is passionately doing her business to provide the family income. Her husband is not in a good physical shape to be employed, so Rozeena is working hard to have the basic necessities of life. She is a mother of five and is motivated to provide them with good quality food, health care, and education. By this time, she has attained a list of regular customers of her town.

In order to make her store fully stocked to cater to more customers time after time, she needs to purchase stock of rice, grains and sugar. For this she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend the increased profit on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rice, grains and sugar, to resell in her store.

loans.name: Sikandar

texts.en:
Ms. Sikandar and her husband have 10 years of experience in making ‘Dahi Bhallay’, an Indian dish consisting of balls made from ground lentils, which are deep-fried and served in a yogurt sauce. The couple has worked hard to gain popularity and recognition within their town, but recent years have been challenging. With the increase in price of vegetables and lentils, the couple was barely able to produce enough to make a good sale.

Two years ago Sikandar borrowed funds for her business from Kashf Foundation in hope of its revival. Today she has been successful in consistently making sales and earning healthy revenue from the business, but they aspire to expand it in anticipation of the growing needs of their children. They have now requested for a loan worth 20,000 PKR and wish to purchase bigger utensils and more packs of salts and spices.

loans.use: to purchase bigger utensils and more packs of salts and spices

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Ms. Jamila is a 50-year-old married lady. She has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over 9 years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required materials. Today she is proud to be famous in her community and to be the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads.

Three years ago, when she borrowed from Kashf for the first time, she wished to invest in buying raw materials. Now she has requested for another loan worth 25,000 PKR to purchase more spools of threads, packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material. She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Jamila has taken up. She has six children; four of her daughters help her in completing orders in less time, while her sons work in a factory.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material

loans.name: Kabeir Group

texts.en:
Kabeir group consists of 4 women from Aden, Yemen. They applied for a 110,000 YER loan from AMB for house renovations.

Suad is a married woman and the leader of the group. She studied in school to the fourth class. She lives in a small old house with her husband and parents-in-law. Her husband's income is not enough to meet life expenses. As a result, she decided to help her husband and start up a small business. She has been going door to door selling women's clothes for about 3 years. She makes a modest profit, however, she used all the money she accumulated to renovate her kitchen and bathroom because they are in a very bad condition.

Now she needs a sum of money to complete renovations, so she asked for a loan of 50,000 YER. Suad is looking forward to expanding her business and selling children's and baby clothes besides women's clothes.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to complete renovations

loans.name: Trob's Group

texts.en:
Trob, aged 26, is living in a rural village of the Srey Snom district and has two children, both of whom are dependents and still in school. She and her husband are farmers in the area to make a living. Together, they have been in this business for 10 years. Her family’s daily income is approximately 10,000 KHR per day  but she can manage to save about 5,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Trob’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle. The previous loan has helped Trob to better support her family with enough food. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. Trob, who is the leader, will use her portion to pay for labor costs in harvesting rice. She hopes to get a high crop yield from her paddy business to better her living conditions.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs in harvesting rice

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Lo

texts.en:
Lo is a villager from a rural area located in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. He is 42 years old and married with four children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. He earns a living through selling ice cream while his wife raises pigs to earn additional income for the family. They have been in this business for two years, earning about 35,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Lo is in his first microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR. With this loan, he is going to use his portion to buy material for producing ice cream to sell. He hopes to earn more income for his family so as to improve their standard of living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy material for producing ice cream to sell

loans.name: Von's Group

texts.en:
Von, age 26, is married and has two children. She supports her family as a farmer who grows rice and chillies and she also supplements her income by selling grocery items. She is able to earn up to 20,000 KHR from the current business which she has been engaged in for seven years. The main challenge for her family’s business is the lack of water supplies for the farmland.

Including this loan, Von has been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, for three loans. Her past loans have helped her better support the business as well as her family. Moreover, her living conditions are getting better day by day. Now, she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items to resell and to pay laborers to harvest the rice. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income and to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to resell

loans.name: Loun's Group

texts.en:
Loun is age 55 years and married with four children, one of whom is still in school. Her family lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey District of Battambang Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice on a four hectare area of farmland for ten years. Loun can earn about 47,000 riels (KHR) per day to meet the family’s needs. Lack of working capital to buy fertilizer for her farmland is the main challenge for her paddy field business.

Loun has been with VisionFund for three cycles, while the other member has been with VisionFund for five cycles. Loun successfully used her previous loans to support her family with enough food. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader, Loun will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her rice paddy so as to make a better living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Pha, 37 years old, is a villager living in a rural area of Sa Ang district in Cambodia’s Kandal province. She is married and a mother of two children, one of whom (a son) is currently a student. 

Pha makes her living through raising pigs. To add more income to the family, Pha’s husband has a business selling charcoal stoves. Each day, this hardworking couple earns around 9 USD per day and, after deducting the daily cost of living, saves approximately 4 USD for future needs. 

Pha is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans that she obtained and completely paid back have enabled her to meet the family’s need. 

Pha is now seeking a USD 1,010 loan to strengthen, as well as expand, her pig-raising business by purchasing more piglets to raise and also pig feed. This requested loan will also be spent on helping her husband’s business by buying more stoves to sell. 

Pha hopes to run her pig-raising business smoothly, as well as raise her pigs fatter and healthier. She also hopes that her husband can sell lots of stoves, which leads to more profit for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to raise and also pig feed.

loans.name: Khoern's Group

texts.en:
Khoern is a 53-year-old married woman who resides in a rural village of Battambang's Moung Russey district in Cambodia. She has five children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. To support her family, Khoern farms rice on two hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for 10 years, she is able to earn around 25,000 KHR daily. The main challenge for her paddy business is an insufficient water supply to irrigate her fields.

Khoern has been with VisionFund for one previous cycle while her group member just joined VisionFund this cycle. Khoern's previous loan has helped her to relieve her family’s financial burden. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a new loan. She will use her portion to pay for labor fees for harvesting rice. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a high yield from her rice paddy in order to improve her standard of living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To pay for labor fees for harvesting rice

loans.name: Sol's Group

texts.en:
Sol, 27, is a married mother of two children who resides in a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice and planting sesame for more than five years. Her business earns her about KHR 28,000 per day to meet the family’s needs.

Sol has been with VisionFund for two cycles while her group members have been with VisionFund for one cycle. Her previous loans have helped Sol to better provide her family with sufficient food. Now she is leading her group of three to apply for a new loan. Sol will use her portion to buy a tractor to help with her rice paddy. She hopes to grow her rice and sesame in a healthful and timely fashion in order to earn a better living.

loans.use: To buy a tractor for her rice paddy

loans.name: Nhan's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kandal province’s Sa Ang district in Cambodia, Nhan is a 53-year-old widow and the mother of seven children, two of whom (a son and a daughter) are still under her responsibility and are currently students. Nhan offers a decent life for her family by working for others as a paid worker and by farming rice. This hard-working single mother earns about 17,000 KHR per day and manages to save approximately 7,000 KHR after meeting her daily expenses. 

Nhan is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan had a huge positive impact on her. Nhan was able to better support her family and, the greatest effect of all, educate her children. 

The lack of working capital to support her rice-growing business has been a great challenge for her. Thus, Nhan is now leading a group which consists of five female members to take out a loan in the amount of 4,100,000 KHR in total. Nhan, the group representative, will utilize her portion of this loan to support her rice-growing business by purchasing fertilizer, rice seed, and pesticides. 

After receiving and efficiently using her requested loan portion, she hopes that her rice field will provide a good-quality crop so that she can sell it at a good price, generating more income for the family. This industrious single mother would love to dedicate all the efforts that she has put into her work to moving her family ahead and, most importantly, further advancing the education of her beloved children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, rice seed, and pesticides

loans.name: Vin's Group

texts.en:
Vin is a resident of Thmor Koul district in Cambodia's Battambang province. She is 43 years old and widowed with three children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, Vin raises pigs and distills alcohol to support her family. She has been in this business for twenty years, earning about 56,000 KHR per day but she can manage to save about 10,000 KHR. 

Vin has been with VisionFund for six cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. The past loans, which she successfully paid back, have helped her relieve her family’s burden. Now she is forming a group of two to ask for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pig feed for nourishing her pigs. She hopes this loan will enable her to fatten them so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for nourishing her pigs

loans.name: Phos' Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province in Cambodia, Phos is 42 years old and married. She has six children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. Phos is a rice farmer, while her husband complements the income by working as paid construction worker in the local area. Engaging in this business for 20 years, together they can earn about 30,000 KHR (Cambodian riles) per day, but they can save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Phos has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle, while the other member has been with VisionFund for four cycles. Phos fully repaid the loans, which have given back to her a good return. Now her living conditions are getting better day by day. 

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Phos will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and will use a portion of it to spend on labor costs in harvesting rice. She hopes to earn more income from her paddy by increasing her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village located in the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province, Vy is 43 and married. She has two children. 

Vy and her husband have struggled to earn a living through planting corn and cassava, and are supplementing the income by working for others for a fee. Vy has been in this business for 11 years. She and her husband are able to earn about 17,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 7,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 
 
Vy has been with VisionFund for three cycles, while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loans have helped Vy to support her family in sufficient food and also support her current business. 

Now Vy is forming a group of two to seek a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to earn a larger income so as to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Anesa's Group

texts.en:
Al-Rafeeq Group consists of three members from Aden, Yemen. All of the members are women. They have requested a 120,000 Yemeni rial (YER) loan for buying women's clothes.

Anesa is a 45-year-old mother of seven children. She only knows how to read and write. Two years ago, Anesa decided to help her husband. He works very hard and does his best to provide his family with food and clothes, but, unfortunately, the money he makes is really not enough. In the beginning, she started going door to door, selling others products in return for a small rate. Now that she's got enough experience selling clothes, she intends to have her own business selling women's clothes; therefore, she asked for a loan of 40,000 YER. She hopes that she will make a profit and will buy a lot of products and sell them to new clients in different quarters and places in her city.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes to sell

loans.name: Ann's Group

texts.en:
Ann resides in a rural village in the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province. She is a 49-year-old mother of eight children. The main source of the family’s income is from planting corn. Sometimes they work for others for a fee. 

Ann has been in this business for 12 years. Together, she and her husband can earn about 20,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day and manage to save about 8,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

This is Ann’s eighth loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. The two other members of her group have been with VisionFund for three to eight cycles. 

Ann’s seventh loan helped relieve her family's burden. Now, she is leading her group in a request for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. Ann will buy seeds and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of the loan for plowing the field. 

She hopes to get a high crop from her corn planting so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Chanthorng's Group

texts.en:
Chanthorng is 33 years old and married. She lives in a rural area of the Ratanak Mondul District of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has one son who is dependent on her. To make a living, she has been planting corn for 10 years as a primary source of the family’s income. The current business earns her about 18,000 riels (KHR) per day and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR per day.

Chanthorng has been with VisionFund for six cycles, while the other members have been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to a-sk for a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, Chanthorng will use her portion to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and use part of it on labor costs in plowing the rice field. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a high yield from her rice paddy so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Som's Group

texts.en:
Som, 50, is a citizen from a village located in the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a married mother of five children. Corn planting is the main source of her family’s income, and her husband also complements the income by raising cows. Som and her husband have been in this business for almost 15 years, earning about 16,000 KHR per day to make a living. 

Som has been with VisionFund for eight cycles, while the other members have been with VisionFund from four to five cycles. The past loans have helped her family to have sufficient foods. 

Now Som is leading her group of three to ask for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and pesticides for her farmland. Som hopes this loan will enable her to grow her business and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Moung Russey District where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Kong is aged 27 years and married with four children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband have struggled to feed their family by farming rice and planting sesame for several years. The current business earns her approximately 16,000 KHR per day.

Kong’s group consists of two members, and she is in her second micro loan with Kiva partner, VisionFund. She fully paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to request another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice and sesame healthfully so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province in Cambodia, Chantha is 58 years old and married. She has 9 children. Chantha is a rice farmer on 1.5 hectares of farmland. She has been in this business for 25 years, earning about 90,000 KHR per day from her current business, and she manages to save about 20,000 KHR after deducting daily expenses.

Chantha has been with VisionFund for seven loan cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles. Chantha fully repaid the past loans which have helped her to expand her field business. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for labor costs in harvesting rice. She hopes to get a high yield from her paddy-field so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs in harvesting rice

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village located in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Sophal is 38 years old and married. She has four children, two of whom are dependents and still in school in the local area. She and her husband earn a living by farming rice as the main source of the family’s income and sometimes they work for others for a fee. Having been in this business for ten years, she can earn about KHR 55,000 per day and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs. 

Sophal has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three loan cycles already and she completely repaid her past loans, which have helped her relieve her family's burden and improve their livelihood. Sophal is now leading her group of two to request a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on paying labor costs for harvesting rice. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn a larger income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Sakhun's Group

texts.en:
Sakhun, 49, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Ek Phnom district. She has four children to take care of. To make a living, she has been farming rice, planting cabbage and supplementing the income by raising cows. The current business earns her family about 27,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sakhun has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles. She successfully paid back the past loans which have helped her to better support her business as well as her family. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds for her plantation and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs for harvesting rice. She hopes to get a high yield from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy seeds for her plantation.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Ms. Bushra is 35-year-old active, married, woman. She has been efficiently conducing a business of cloth trade from her home for the last 10 years. Her husband brings cut pieces from factories and the market, and then she sells to the people in her community. She makes enough to lead a decent life, though her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the everyday expenditures of the household. She is the loving mother of eight children and is in charge of providing them with good food, health care and education. In order to improve her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase fabrics in bulk from the market in various colors and designs to meet the needs of her customers. She expects more profits, and thus can better support her family. She desires to spend a part of the income on providing good quality education to her family.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics in bulk from the market in various colors and designs to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en: Ms. Shamshad is a 41-year-old active woman and the mother of one child. For the past 20 years, she has been running a business selling milk, with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Shamshad’s husband. She has built a regular list of customers and has 10 buffaloes in milk. She prepares feed for the buffaloes and looks after them. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, as well as financial matters. She has some savings and has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase another buffalo. She is hopeful to get a boost in her earnings and wishes to purchase her own house.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo for her dairy business.

loans.name: Basheeran

texts.en:
Ms. Basheeran is a 45-year-old working woman. She lives in a small house with her husband and two children. She is a professional confectioner and runs her own business of sweet making with the help of her husband. Basheeran’s 50-year-old husband helps her sell products out in the nearby markets. She has been with Kashf Foundation for the last four years and has been able to establish her business at a level that she can earn up to 1,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) in a day. Though Basheeran is not well educated, she wants her children to go to good educational institutes for a prosperous future. 

Basheeran has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to purchase more packs of oil and stock of sugar. Basheeran is very confident of her professional skills and happy that she will be able to earn more money to give a prosperous life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of oil and stock of sugar.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Ms Shahnaz is a 48-year-old married woman. She has efficiently run a business of stitching for the last 12 years. Her stitching is very famous in her town and she has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community members. She makes enough to lead a decent life while her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the everyday expenditures of the household. She is a loving mother of six children and is in charge of providing them with good food, health and education. In order to meet the orders of her customers on time, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000/- to purchase stock of threads and packs of buttons, laces and zippers. She expects more profits and hence can better support her family members.

loans.use: to purchase stock of threads and packs of buttons, laces and zippers.
